title: MTAL 594z Master's Thesis
description: Registration Restriction: Open only to master students

title: MTAL 589 Community Music Practicum
description: Provides structure and support as students design, develop and execute a community music project as part of an existing organization or a new endeavor.

title: MTAL 588 Guided Practice
description: Student teachers observe and teach under the guidance of a university supervisor (USC professor) and a master teacher.

title: MTAL 585 Research and Practice in Orff Schulwerk
description: Exploring research on the philosophical and historical bases of the Orff Schulwerk approach and acquiring skills in pedagogical applications in early childhood through collegiate settings.

title: MTAL 584 Early Childhood Music
description: An overview of significant developmental issues, current research, and appropriate practices for children from birth to age eight. Professor-guided practicum teaching.

title: MTAL 576 Using Technology in the Classroom
description: Study of the tools and knowledge necessary to the music educator to facilitate the application of computers and electronic music in music education.

title: MTAL 552 Music Education Courseware Development
description: Development of music education courseware using current technology. Two lecture hours per week.

title: MTAL 550 Teaching Music Fundamentals and Appreciation Courses
description: Purpose and objectives of music in general education. Survey of current approaches and materials.

title: MTAL 538 Music in the Community, Program Development and Evaluation
description: Explores the design and development of community music programs, including community needs assessment, program delivery and strategies and applications for program evaluation.

title: MTAL 537 Community Engagement Models and Frameworks in Music
description: Explores frameworks of partnerships and community organizations to inform innovative design, negotiate complexity and problem-solve in community music organizations.

title: MTAL 535 Community Engagement Through Music
description: Explores the essential role of community and arts partnerships in music education with implications for the expanding entrepreneurial role of musician/educators.

title: MTAL 510 Leading a Music Program in a Public School Setting
description: The philosophy and purposes of music programs combined with early field experiences, varied teaching strategies, and music learning assessment.

title: MTAL 505 Teaching and Learning Music
description: Studies of the latest resources concerning the teaching and learning of music so that musicians can function more effectively as both teachers and performers.

title: MTAL 504 Psychological Foundations of Music
description: Exploration of theories, research and practice in psychological foundations of music teaching and learning.

title: MTAL 503 Philosophical and Advocacy Issues in Music Teaching and Learning
description: Exploration of philosophical thinking in the field of music with emphasis on philosophical foundations for teaching and learning.

title: MTAL 502 Sociological Foundations of Music Teaching and Learning
description: Study of interdependent relationship between society, music and music education.

title: MDA 501 Introduction to Visual Studies: Methods and Debates
description: A critical introduction to the field of visual studies focusing on interdisciplinary approaches to images, objects, and visual technologies as well as key texts and interpretive debates. Students must be enrolled in a PhD program at USC.

title: MDA 599 Special Topics
description: The multidisciplinary, team-taught seminar addresses issues at the intersection of literary, visual, and material culture. The faculty team and specific topics studied will change each time the course is offered.

title: MDA 499 Special Topics
description: Selected topics in Multidisciplinary Activities.

title: MDA 496 Interdisciplinary Honors Thesis
description: The second part of an eight-unit sequence intended to award academic honors in a thematic area comparable to departmental honors in a single discipline.

title: MDA 495 Interdisciplinary Honors Seminar
description: The first part of an eight-unit sequence intended to award academic honors in a thematic area comparable to departmental honors in a single discipline.

title: MDA 494 Directed Creative Project
description: Individual research, reading, writing and project development, guided by a faculty member with expertise in the area, who may be tenure-track or nontenure- track.

title: MDA 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research, reading, writing and project development.

title: MDA 476 Policy Research on California
description: Research and proposed solutions concerning problems, policies, structural and constitutional challenges facing California. Open only to upper-division and master's students.

title: MDA 460 Collaborative Learning Project
description: A project approved by a faculty committee, requiring students to collaborate on research or an original work in the literary, plastic, or performing arts.

title: MDA 399a Team Research Communities
description: Cross-disciplinary inquiry in the liberal arts. Research methodologies.

title: MDA 450 Individual Program of Study
description: An individual educational project approved by a faculty committee, combining directed research with internships, service learning, artistic or literary production, and/or other relevant educational activities.

title: MDA 399b Team Research Communities
description: Cross-disciplinary inquiry in the liberal arts. Individual student and group projects contributing to the team's collaborative report.

title: MDA 365 The Art and Adventure of Leadership
description: Areas of knowledge and kinds of competencies that are fundamental to the study and practice of leadership in a variety of settings.

title: MDA 333 Colloquium in Armenian Studies: Social and Cultural Issues
description: Analysis of political, social, and cultural issues by the instructor and visiting lecturers with expertise in specific areas of the Armenian Republic and Diaspora community.

title: MDA 320 Global Ethics: Poverty, Health and the Human Condition
description: Ethical challenges and moral obligations of the public and private sectors in global development, access to healthcare, and promotion of civil, political, and economic rights.

title: MDA 330 The Armenian Heritage: History, Arts, and Culture
description: A multidisciplinary exploration of the Armenian cultural heritage through the ages — folklore, traditions, religious practices, literature, architecture, painting, sculpture, music, theatre, film and dance.

title: MDES 180g The Middle East
description: Introduction to the history and the study of the Middle East from ancient to modern times.

title: MDA 300 The Dornsife Toolkit
description: Registration Restriction: Open to all undergraduates, though Dornsife majors and minors will have priority during the registration period

title: MDA 260 Opportunities in the Global Marketplace
description: Professional opportunities in a changing global system, preparing the successor generation for participation in the public, private, and citizen sectors of our global society.

title: MDA 250 Internship for Liberal Arts: Work and Career — Theory and Practice
description: Students explore different understandings of work and career in American society while testing theories in an actual work setting.

title: MDA 205g Cities and Civilization
description: Origins of cities, patterns of migration and resettlement, civic identities and the invention of public culture, from ancient Rome to contemporary Los Angeles.

title: MDA 200Lg The Cutting Edge: From Basic Science to the Marketplace
description: An introduction to the basic sciences of physics, chemistry, biology, and geology, examining the fundamental concepts, experimental approaches, and technological applications. Course will show the interrelationships among the fields and societal ramifications of these cutting edge technologies.

title: MDA 175Lg Science and Technology
description: The nature of science and technology, based on a focused study of a single area of research; scientific principles, their technological applications, and social significance.

title: MDA 170g La Frontera: The U.S.-Mexico Borderlands
description: Provides student with a multidisciplinary understanding of the U.S./Mexico border region. Topics to be covered include: space and place, internationalization, physical environment, gender relations and culture.

title: MDA 167g Marginal Groups in America
description: Sociological and historical analysis of marginal populations in American society, including racial and ethnic minorities, teenage mothers, drug abusers, criminals, and the mentally ill.

title: MDA 165g Social Inquiry
description: Analyses of compelling local, national, and/or international issues; analytical tools examined systematically in a broad range of social phenomena.

title: MDA 155g Cultural Forms and Values II
description: Cultural norms and patterns of civilizations associated with Africa, Asia, Latin America, the Middle East, Native America, and elsewhere, alternative to those of the Greco-Roman and European traditions.

title: MDA 125Lg Scientific Principles
description: Fundamental principles underlying a body of scientific knowledge and their evolution; the nature of scientific inquiry; how scientific knowledge is obtained and evaluated. A field experience or practical component required.

title: MDA 120 American Popular Culture
description: Introduction to the popular culture of the United States, including basic history, geography, literature and the arts, as understood by generally well-educated young Americans.

title: MDA 140 Practicum in Multimedia Authorship
description: Introduction to the expressive potential of multimedia as a critical and creative tool, supplementing traditional forms of academic work.

title: MDA 110 Contemporary Issues and Cases in Health Care
description: An introduction to the major areas of health care; the provider's relationship to choices in professional practice; ethics and historical context.

title: MDA 105g Cultural Forms and Values I
description: Norms and patterns of civilizations associated with the Greco-Roman and European traditions and the legacy of those traditions in North America.

title: MDA 100d Introduction to the Health Professions
description: An introduction to the health professions, through lectures, discussions, clinical experiences, and visits to health care delivery sites; relationships with other clinicians and the community. Departmental approval required.

title: MDA 310 Peace and Conflict Studies
description: Interdisciplinary study of the pursuit of peace, including causes of wars, arms races, conflict resolution, peace movements, nonviolent resistance, and peace with justice.

title: MDA 101x Health Professions: Prospects and Preparation
description: Presentations by health professionals, introduced by faculty members from relevant academic units and followed by discussion with the speakers.

title: MDA 100b Introduction to the Health Professions
description: An introduction to the health professions, through lectures, discussions, clinical experiences, and visits to health care delivery sites; relationships with other clinicians and the community. Departmental approval required.

title: MASC 575 Basics of Atomistic Simulation of Materials
description: Building a parallel computer from components; molecular dynamics method; computation of structural, thermodynamics and transport properties; simulation projects.

title: MASC 576 Molecular Dynamics Simulations of Materials and Processes
description: Molecular dynamics method for atomistic simulations of materials and processes, simulations using parallel computing, correlation functions for structural and dynamical properties plus simulation project.

title: MASC 564 Composites Processing
description: Science underlying processes used to manufacture composite parts. Scope - constituent materials, processing challenges, defect control strategies, and bases for material and process selection/design.

title: MASC 570 Introduction to Photovoltaic Solar Energy Conversion
description: Introduction to the physical principles, implementation materials, devices, and manufacturing costs of solar cells and panels for photovoltaic conversion of solar radiation to electricity.

title: MASC 562 Failure Analysis
description: Apply fundamental Materials Science concepts to "real-world" material/product failures. Identify causes of material failures using analytical methodology/tools. Develop practical solutions to prevent future failures.

title: MASC 561 Dislocation Theory and Applications
description: Elasticity theory; types, sources, motion, interaction of dislocations; stress fields and strain energies; partial dislocations and stacking faults; principles of work-hardening.

title: MASC 560 Fatigue and Fracture
description: Behavior of materials under cyclic and static fatigue; plastic instability; life-time predictions; brittle and ductile fracture; crack propagation and plastic blunting.

title: MASC 559 Creep
description: Behavior of engineering materials at elevated temperatures; thermal stresses; creep mechanisms; interpretation of creep data; methods of predicting long-term strains.

title: MASC 551 Mechanical Behavior of Engineering Materials
description: Mechanical properties of materials; macroscopic mechanical behavior related to structure and microstructure of the material; elementary dislocation theory related to basic strengthening mechanisms; fatigue and fracture; nanomaterials.

title: MASC 535L Transmission Electron Microscopy
description: Transmission electron microscopy and techniques. Specimen-electron beam interaction, electron diffraction and image formation. X-ray microanalysis. Laboratory involves hands-on training on the transmission electron microscope.

title: MASC 534 Materials Characterization
description: Characterization of solids by optical microscopy, electron microscopy, (TEM, SEM) and elemental and structural analysis (EPMA, ESCA, AES, SIMS, HEED, LEED, SED).

title: MASC 524 Techniques and Mechanisms in Electrochemistry
description: Modern electrochemistry; in-situ techniques; in-situ probes of the near-electrode region; ex-situ emersion techniques; cyclic voltammetry, electroxidation, electrochemical reduction, reactive film formation, enzyme electrochemistry.

title: MASC 514L Processing of Advanced Semiconductor Devices
description: Statistical design of experiments, vapor deposition of thin film dielectrics, plasma etching, advanced lithography, in-situ sensors, process monitoring, quality control, assurance/reliability.

title: MASC 512 Thin Film Science and Technology
description: Science and technology of thin films; historical developments and motivation to achieve thin films, synthesis techniques, materials characterization, physical properties, and applications of thin films.

title: MASC 511 Materials Preparation
description: Principles and techniques of materials preparation; purification, crystal growth from liquid and vapor phases, sintering.

title: MATH 681 Selected Topics in Functional Analysis
description: Course content will vary with professor and academic year offered. It will include topics of current interest in both linear and nonlinear functional analysis and their applications.

title: MATH 680 Nonlinear Functional Analysis
description: Calculus in Banach spaces, degree theory, fixed point theorems. Study of compact, monotone, accretive and nonexpansive operators.

title: MATH 665 Topics in Ordinary Differential Equations
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MATH 650 Seminar in Statistical Consulting
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MATH 655 Topics in Partial Differential Equations
description: Topics to be chosen from the following: Elliptic, Parabolic, Hyperbolic, and Dispersive PDEs, Conservation Laws, Mathematical Fluid Dynamics and Variational Methods.

title: MATH 647 Topics in Statistics
description: Current methods, techniques, and results in statistics, data science and machine learning.

title: MATH 641 Topics in Topology
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MATH 625 Topics in Real Analysis
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MATH 630 Topics in Number Theory
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MATH 620 Topics in Complex Analysis
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MATH 635 Topics in Differential Geometry
description: Topics to be chosen from the following: geometry of complex manifolds, relations between topology and curvature, homogeneous spaces, symmetric spaces, geometry of submanifolds.

title: MASC 539 Engineering Quantum Mechanics
description: Quantum mechanics for engineering majors who work with solid-state devices, quantum electronics, and photonics. Schroedinger equation, perturbation theory, electronic and optical processes.

title: MATH 614 Topics in Algebraic Geometry
description: Introduction to both classical and modern aspects of algebraic geometry. Topics include aspects of commutative algebra, algebraic curves, algebraic varieties and schemes, and sheaf cohomology.

title: MATH 610 Topics in Algebra
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MATH 613 Topics in Representation Theory
description: Structure and representation theory of various algebraic structures, such as groups, Lie algebras, Hopf algebras, algebraic groups, or group schemes.

title: MATH 606 Topics in Stochastic Processes
description: Theoretic and applied topics of current interest in discrete and continuous time stochastic processes and in stochastic differential equations.

title: MATH 612 Topics in Commutative Ring Theory
description: Localization, structure of Noetherian rings, integral extensions, valuation theory, graded rings, characteristic functions, local algebra, dimension theory.

title: MATH 605 Topics in Probability
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MATH 602 Galerkin Approximation Methods in Partial Differential Equations
description: Galerkin methods of approximating solutions of elliptic boundary value problems in one and several dimensions; includes the use of spline functions and triangularizations.

title: MATH 600 Topics in Numerical Analysis
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MATH 601 Optimization Theory and Techniques
description: Necessary and sufficient conditions for existence of extrema with equality constraints; gradient methods; Ritz methods; eigenvalue problems; optimum control problems; inequality constraints; mathematical programming.

title: MATH 599 Special Topics
description: Course content will be selected each semester to reflect current trends and developments in the field of mathematics.

title: MATH 596 Internship for Curricular Practical Training
description: Part-time or full-time, practical work experience in the student's field of study. The internship must be located at an off-campus facility. Students are individually supervised by faculty. May not be taken until the student has completed at least one semester of enrollment in the graduate program with a cumulative 3.0 GPA.

title: MATH 595 Practicum in Teaching the Liberal Arts: Mathematics
description: Practical principles for the long-term development of effective teaching within college disciplines. Intended for teaching assistants in Dornsife College.

title: MASC 505 Crystals and Anisotropy
description: Stereographic projection; Laue back reflection method; crystal orientation; line and planar crystalline defects; tensors; susceptibility; permeability and permittivity; stress and strain; piezoelectricity; elasticity.

title: MASC 503 Thermodynamics of Materials
description: Classical thermodynamics, chemical potential, pure phases and mixtures; interphase relationships; binary and ternary solutions; free energy and activity; galvanic cell, electrochemical potential and Pourbaix diagram.

title: MASC 504 Diffusion and Phase Equilibria
description: Phase equilibria; phase diagrams; diffusion; planar defects; nucleation and growth; spinodal decomposition; phase transformation.

title: MASC 502 Advanced Solid State
description: Semiconductors, dielectrics and metals, thermoelectric effects, magnetism, magnetic resonance and superconductivity.

title: MASC 501 Solid State
description: Atomic structure, bonding in covalent, ionic and Van der Waals crystals, Brillouin zones, lattices, diffraction, electronic states, lattice vibrations, specific heat, electrical conductivity, and magnetism.

title: MASC 499 Special Topics
description: Course content will be selected each semester to reflect current trends and developments in the field of materials science.

title: MASC 440 Materials and the Environment
description: Interactions of metals, alloys and composite materials with liquid and gaseous corrosive environments; corrosion protection by alloying and application of inhibitors and metallic or organic coatings.

title: MASC 439 Principles of Semiconductor Processing
description: Principles relevant to semiconductor processing are covered. Topics include bulk and epitaxial crystal growth, photolithography, evaporation, sputtering, etching, oxidation, alloying, and ion implantation.

title: MATH 594z Master's Thesis
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: MASC 350L Nanostructured Materials: Design, Synthesis, and Processing
description: Structure, properties, synthesis, processing and design of metallic, ceramic, polymeric, electronic, photonic, composite, nanophase and biomaterials; nanostructures, microfabrication and smart materials.

title: MASC 507 Micro- and Nano-Fabrication Technology
description: Physical basis of technologies for the fabrication of micro- and nano-scale devices. Thin-film deposition, etching, and material modification processes; patterntransfer methods.

title: MASC 506 Semiconductor Physics
description: Semiconductor bonds, crystallography, band structure assumptions, group theory, band structure results, k.p. method, quantum wells, wires and dots, superlattices, amorphous, organic semiconductors, defects, statistics, surfaces.

title: MASC 110L Materials Science
description: Chemical bonding and structure in crystalline, amorphous, and molecular solids; tendency and mechanisms for chemical change; homogeneous and heterogeneous equilibria.

title: MASC 508 Nano-Fabrication Lithography
description: Physical basis of lithography methods for nano-scale devices. Photon-, electron-, and ion-based systems, advanced processes; resolution enhancement techniques; directed self assembly.

description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: MASC 471 Applied Quantum Mechanics for Engineers
description: Introductory quantum mechanics and applications. Schrodinger equation, atomic and molecular processes, time-dependent perturbation theory. Applications to lasers, solid-state demos and gaseous devices.

title: LING 645 Seminar in Language Change
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MASC 438L Processing for Microelectronics
description: Applications and electrical evaluation of selected processes used in electronic microfabrication.

title: LING 632 Seminar in Phonetics
description: Readings in phonetic theory and current research as the framework for a discussion-oriented class.

title: LING 627 Seminar in Second Language Acquisition
description: Readings in second language acquisition as the framework for a discussion and research-oriented seminar.

title: LING 615 Seminar in Linguistics Structures
description: Analysis of the synchronic or diachronic phonology, morphology, and syntax of individual languages.

title: LING 610 Seminar in Linguistic Theory
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: LING 602 Seminar in Experimental Methods in Linguistics
description: Topics in quantitative methods in linguistics research, e.g., covariance structure analysis, multi-dimensional scaling, log linear model, metaanalysis.

description: Practical principles for the long-term development of effective teaching within college disciplines.

description: Using hands-on and research techniques, study of the role of linguistic knowledge and the procedures that implement it in computational systems that process natural language.

title: LING 580 General Phonetics
description: Familiarization with articulation, transcription, production, and acoustic analysis of the speech sounds found in the world's languages. Also speech technology, perception, and disorders. Includes laboratory exercises.

title: LING 582 Experimental Phonetics
description: Source-filter theory, acoustic correlates of speech sounds, vocal tract and auditory physiology, coarticulation and motor coordination, speech technology including synthesis and recognition, experimental design and statistics, and speech perception.

title: LING 595 Directed Readings
description: Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: LING 579 Child Language Development
description: Acquisition of grammatical, discourse, and conversational competence; strategies and structures.

title: LING 573 Sociolinguistics
description: Theoretical approaches to language in social context; discourse analysis, ethnography of communication, variation theory.

title: LING 581 Topics in Advanced Phonology
description: Topics in advanced formal phonology; theoretical issues in the interface of phonology with other areas of linguistics; literature study on themes of current theoretical relevance.

title: LING 550 Advanced English Linguistics
description: The analysis of problems in the grammatical description and history of English.

title: LING 555 Comparative Germanic Linguistics
description: Nature and relationship of changes that led to the differentiation of the individual Germanic languages.

title: LING 548 Lexical Semantics
description: Languages group meaning elements together in different ways to form words. Consideration of how to identify these elements and how speakers map them into lexico-syntactic units.

title: LING 547 Morphology
description: Introduction to morphology: words versus sentences, the grammar of words, the various notions of "lexicon," the architecture of the phonological component. This course is in preparation for advanced work in linguistic theory.

title: LING 546 Comparative Indo-European Linguistics
description: Analysis of the phonological, morphological, and syntactic structures of Proto-Indo-European, and its development in the various branches of Indo-European.

title: LING 540 Field Methods in Linguistics
description: Recording and analysis of a living language as employed by a native speaker of that language.

title: LING 542 Historical Linguistics
description: Principles of language change; the comparative method; structural and social factors in language change.

title: LING 541 Field Methods in Second Language Acquisition
description: Research design and methodology; data collection, coding, and analysis; ethical considerations.

title: LING 539 Japanese/Korean Syntax and Theoretical Implications
description: Critical discussion of selected papers and dissertations on Japanese/Korean syntax and consideration of their theoretical implications.

title: LING 538 Selected Topics in Romance Syntax
description: Overview of selected topics in Romance Syntax within a comparative perspective and their contribution towards the understanding of a general theory of grammar.

title: LING 537 Advanced Syntax
description: Topics in advanced formal syntax; current literature leading to open questions in research; survey of important and controversial issues of current theoretical relevance.

title: LING 536 Semantics
description: Current linguistic approaches to the semantics of natural language; analysis of concepts of meaning and reference.

description: Two-week study abroad course that explores the health dynamics and health care settings of India.

title: MEDS 552 Clinical Medicine and Health Care Reform in Jordan

title: MEDS 555 Clinical Medicine and Healthcare Access in Honduras
description: A three-week hybrid course providing students with hands-on experience in clinical medicine/public health and exposure to the various socio-economic factors impacting healthcare delivery in the developing world, specifically in Honduras.

title: MEDS 550 Clinical Medicine and Health Care Reform in Taiwan
description: Two-week in-depth study abroad in Taipei, Taiwan, focused on understanding Taiwan's health care system, health priorities, and needs.

title: MEDS 554 Clinical Medicine and Healthcare Delivery in Panama
description: A two-week course providing students with hands-on experience in the practice of rural medicine as they gain exposure to the various socio-economic factors present in Bocas del Toro, Panama.

description: Introduction to refugee health care and life events which impact health. Discuss medical needs of long-term displaced populations with specific case studies.

title: MEDS 519 Global Oral Health

title: MEDS 517 Health and Human Rights

title: MEDS 518 Children in Emergency Situations: Global Policies and Programs

title: MEDS 515 Global Health Modules, HIV/AIDS

title: MEDS 516 Cultural Competence in Health and Medicine
description: Practical approach to the development of professional skills for providing culturally sensitive clinical health services to ethnically and linguistically diverse patients.

title: MEDS 514 Global Health Modules, Tropical Disease

title: MEDS 513 Global Health Modules, Maternal and Child Health II

title: MEDS 511 Global Health Modules, Tuberculosis

title: MEDS 510 Global Health Modules, Malaria
description: Critical issues in international control and treatment of malaria. Exploration of biological and epidemiological fundamentals of human-parasite interaction, including dynamics of transmission among populations.

title: MEDS 512 Global Health Modules, Maternal and Child Health I
description: Biopsychosocial, cultural and economic aspects of women's health: pregnancy, childbirth, marriage. Examination of health promotion and policy efforts to improve women's health globally.

title: MEDS 504L Core Principles System II

title: MEDS 500 Basic Concepts in Global Health
description: Exploration of global health issues facing resource-poor societies; emphasizes contributing factors including behavioral and physiological bases, economic, social, and political context.

title: MEDS 502 Global Epidemiology of Diseases and Risk Factors
description: Survey of major populations' crises and risk factors accounting for global health challenges. Evaluation of case studies of global health interventions and effective methodologies.

title: MEDS 501 Critical Issues in Global Health
description: Evaluation of government and non-government organizations' new global health responses, and critical issues affecting global health including: environment, workforce conditions, obesity, nutrition, drugs, poverty.

title: MEDS 465 Wilderness and Survival Medicine
description: Medical physiology principles of people under "extreme" wilderness conditions, factors affecting remote medical care, and basic survival strategies, led by Emergency Medicine physicians.

title: MEDS 490x Directed Research in Biomedical Science
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MEDS 460 Emergency Health Care
description: Principles of emergency medical services, ranging from prehospital care and advanced life-saving, to minor injuries and illnesses. Interactive experience with ER physicians/emergency health care providers.

title: MEDS 455 Integrative Health Care
description: Introduction to integrative health care; a holistic approach to medicine combining conventional medical therapies with evidence-informed complementary alternative medicine.

title: MEDS 450 OB/GYN: The Medicine and Surgery of Reproduction
description: An introduction to the practical realities of modern obstetric and gynecology practice from the point of view of practicing surgeon scientists at USC.

title: MEDS 445 Cancer: Introduction to Oncology in the Modern Era
description: Introduction to the spectrum of clinical and scientific issues surrounding contemporary cancer care – molecular diagnostics, genomic medicine, modern therapeutics, and community/patient engagement.

title: MEDS 425 Medical Examiner-Coroner: Investigating Death
description: Emphasizes the team-based approach used by forensic scientists, medical examiners and coroners to investigate the circumstances and determine the cause/manner of death.

title: MEDS 420 Clinical Pediatrics
description: Explores enduring and fascinating topics in Pediatrics through a modern lens, incorporating first hand patient-care experiences in clinics and hospitals, and didactic case-based discussions.

title: MEDS 440 Introduction to Surgical Principles
description: Introduction to the spectrum of surgical care, taught by surgeons, with the goal of developing an appreciation of the role that surgery plays in society.

title: MEDS 390 Special Problems
description: Supervised, individual studies. No more than one registration permitted. Enrollment by petition only.

title: MEDS 370 Organ Failure: Non-Communicable Chronic Disease
description: An examination of frequently treated diseases with the greatest impact on society. Involvement of medical specialists and actual patients as guests.

title: MEDS 380 Stem Cells: Fact and Fiction
description: Exploring how stem cells and regenerative medicine are portrayed in culture, the scientific underpinnings of what is currently possible, and visions into the future.

title: MPGU 428a Improvisation and Arranging for Guitarists
description: Principles of improvisation and impromptu arranging; comparison and application of techniques and musical styles of the various kinds of guitars and related fretted instruments.

title: MEDS 355 Skeletal Biology and Pathology: No Bones About It
description: Overview of the cellular make-up of the human skeleton, the functions of bones, clinical application of this knowledge towards bone-related diseases, and introduction to technological advances in orthopedic surgery.

title: MPGU 427 Advanced Topics in Classical Guitar History and Literature
description: An in-depth study of major works for lute, vihuela and classical guitar, with emphasis on early music and the music of the 20th century.

title: MPGU 426 Classical Guitar History and Literature
description: A survey of music for the guitar, lute and vihuela from 1500 to the present.

title: MPGU 420 Guitar Styles
description: Detailed exploration of a specific style or genre of guitar playing through study of repertoire, history and practice, and exploration of techniques.

title: MPGU 417 Classical Guitar Pedagogy
description: Teaching techniques and literature; function of the hands; acoustical properties of instruments.

title: MEDS 360 From Bench to Bedside: New Frontiers in Biomedical Research
description: A theoretical basis of laboratory approaches that help the biomedical or physician scientist in understanding the etiology of disease and targeting disease processes.

title: MPGU 416 Evolution of the Guitar in the United States
description: Historical survey of styles, literature and performance practice; emphasis on playing technique and interpretation. A time-line study relating guitar to popular music and historical events.

title: MPGU 415 Studio Guitar Pedagogy
description: Teaching techniques and literature; function of the hands; acoustical properties of instruments.

title: MEDS 350 Neurochemistry of Addiction: Drugs, Brain, and Behavior
description: The neurochemistry of psychiatric illness and addiction, introduction to brain and nervous system biochemistry, anatomy and disease states. Covers prescribed medications and drugs of abuse.

title: MPGU 390 Special Problems
description: Supervised, individual studies. No more than one registration permitted. Enrollment by petition only.

title: MPGU 358 Performance Practices for Studio Guitarists
description: Rehearsal procedures; stage deportment; interpretation of solo and ensemble literature; preparation for recitals and professional performance.

title: MPGU 353 Individual Instruction
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MPGU 335 Jazz Guitar Master Class
description: Explore the music of Joe Diorio, Wes Montgomery and John Coltrane in a master class setting.

title: MPGU 357 Advanced Classical Guitar Techniques
description: An in-depth exploration of the most advanced facets of classical guitar technique.

title: MPGU 301 Individual Instruction
description: Intermediate and advanced instruction on secondary instrument for music majors, on principal instrument for music minors and BA music majors.

title: MPGU 300x Non-Major Individual Instruction
description: Intermediate and advanced instruction designed for non-music majors. Not available for credit to music majors.

title: MPGU 259 Functional Skills for Classical Guitarists I
description: Fundamentals of music theory experienced through the medium of the classical guitar. Topics include analysis of important guitar works, basso continuo realization, arranging, and improvisation.

title: MPGU 260 Improvising and Arranging for Jazz Guitar
description: Study and application of principles of improvisation and arranging for Jazz Guitar.

title: MPGU 258 Functional Skills for Studio Guitarists I
description: Melodic and chordal topics applied to the total fingerboard; successful completion required for junior standing.

title: MPGU 257 Classical Guitar Performance Class
description: Technical problems; solo and ensemble literature; interpretation; professional preparation. Required of first and second year Classical Guitar majors each semester in residence.

title: MPGU 253 Individual Instruction
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MPGU 160b Functional Skills for the Jazz Guitarist
description: Study of theory, technique, and fingerboard organization of melodic and harmonic topics as applied to guitar.

title: MPGU 160a Functional Skills for the Jazz Guitarist
description: Study of theory, technique, and fingerboard organization of melodic and harmonic topics as applied to guitar.

title: MPGU 159 Functional Skills for Studio Guitarists I
description: Study of technique, theory and aural skills as applied to guitar; fingerboard organization of melodic and chordal topics; sight reading.

title: MPGU 158 Guitarists in the U.S.
description: Study of the lives and music of influential guitarists; analysis of musical and technical details.

title: MEDS 330 Bionics: Solutions to Enable the Disabled
description: Focused examination of medical bionics with emphasis on solutions that enable the disabled and detailed discussions and evaluations of the social and technological aspects of bionic medical devices.

title: MEDS 335 Human Development: From Stem to Sternum
description: An introduction to transformation of a single cell into a mature organism.

title: MEDS 340 The Brain in Health and Disease
description: Study of the human brain with emphasis on structure-functional relationships, illustrative case studies, current imaging techniques, with illustrative laboratory exercises using specimens and slides.

title: MEDS 300g Statistical Methods for Biomedical Research
description: Fundamental basis for various statistical tests, underlying assumptions, and statistical analyses used in biomedical and clinical research.

title: MEDS 320 Human Cadaveric Anatomy
description: Anatomical structure and function of the major regions of the human body as related to health and disease, using clinical cases, lectures and cadaveric demonstrations.

title: MEDS 315 Human Anatomy, Physiology, and the Technology of Medicine
description: Introduction to human anatomy and physiology in relation to common disease processes, and an examination of how technology has transformed western medicine throughout history.

title: MEDS 280 The History of Medicine: a Doctor's Perspective
description: Explores the role of medicine/surgery in society, whose ideas about health and disease have undergone enormous changes from antiquity to the present day.

title: MEDS 220 Preparation for the Clinical Experience
description: Discussion and exercises in clinically relevant topics (professional behavior, patient privacy, medical ethics, cultural competency, teamwork, etc.) in preparation for experience in the clinical setting.

title: MEDS 260 Challenges in the Forefront of Biomedical Ethics
description: Examination of fundamental ethical concepts and principles in clinical health care and biomedical research. Use of film, case studies and discussion.

title: MEDB 794z Doctoral Dissertation
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: MEDB 794d Doctoral Dissertation
description: Registration Restriction: Open only to doctoral students.

title: MEDB 794c Doctoral Dissertation
description: Registration Restriction: Open only to doctoral students.

title: MEDB 794a Doctoral Dissertation
description: Registration Restriction: Open only to doctoral students.

title: MDES 492 Honors Thesis
description: Writing of the honors thesis; for students in the Middle East Studies Honors Program.

title: MEDB 790 Research
description: Research leading to the doctorate. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

title: MEDB 794b Doctoral Dissertation
description: Registration Restriction: Open only to doctoral students.

description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MPGU 153 Individual Instruction
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: MDES 454 Classical Arabic
description: Introduction to reading and interpretation of pre-modern, classical Arabic, including literature from the 6th to 19th centuries.

title: MDES 441w Cities of the Middle East
description: An examination of the economic, political and cultural forces operating in a number of Middle Eastern cities.

title: MDES 463 Islam and Arab Nationalism
description: Historical, sociological and political processes that have shaped the emergence of and relationship between Arab nationalism and political Islam since the early 20th century.

title: MDES 345p Power and Authority in the Middle East
description: A comparative examination of social relations of power and institutions with a special focus on intellectual traditions, the law, and social movements.

title: MDES 480 Seminar in Middle East History
description: A readings and research seminar dealing with one topic in the history of the Middle East. Topics will change each time the course is offered.

title: MDES 342g Modern Arab State and Society I: Media and Intellectual Works
description: Surveys prominent debates in the Arab world, examining how media and intellectual production reflect, shape, and/or contest prevailing ideas and practices in the public sphere.

title: MDES 343g Modern Arab State and Society II: Culture and Literature
description: Examines contemporary Arab state-society relations using literature to illustrate how people construct meanings and portray issues of national, social, and cultural significance.

title: MDES 340 The United States and the Middle East
description: Critical perspectives on U.S. relations with the Middle East, including the discourses surrounding democracy and globalization.

title: MDES 335 Nation and State in Modern Turkey
description: An examination of nation-state building in modern Turkey through a juxtaposition of academic works from history, anthropology, sociology, political science, and literary criticism.

title: MDES 325g Politics of Film and Literature in Modern Iran
description: Explores contemporary Iranian society through the study of social tensions created by poverty-wealth, tradition-modernity, masculinity-femininity, and notions of religio-political authority as reflected in the literature and films of the country.

title: MDES 324 Classical Persian Literature in Translation
description: Introduction to literary culture of premodern Persia, from about 800–1800 AD. Emphasis on poetry, the most extensive, prestigious, and influential medium of Persian literature.

title: MDES 316p The Great Muslim Empires of the Near East and India
description: Explores the social, political, and religious forces that helped shape the Ottoman, Safavid, and the Mughal empires, their intellectual trends, and cultural dynamism.

title: MDES 384 Popular Culture in the Middle East
description: Examination of the Middle East through the prism of its popular cultures; emphasis on audio, visual, and literary representations in relation to colonialism, nation-building, and globalization.

title: MDES 313 Modern Iran
description: History and culture of modern Iran from the nineteenth century to present through historical and ethnographic approaches to Iran today, richly contextualizing events and people.

title: MDES 314p Political Thought in the Middle East
description: Major strands of Islamic political thought from early Islam through the classical Islamic period to contemporary developments and transformations.

title: MDES 383 The Modern Middle East
description: Survey of major political, economic, and cultural developments in the Middle East on the basis of documents, literature, and film produced in the region.

title: MDES 382 The Middle East, 500–1500
description: Major topics, themes, and representative writings in the history and literature of the Arabic and Islamic World during the Medieval period.

title: MDES 312 Medieval Iran: Society and Culture
description: Political and dynastic history of Iran from the Arab conquest in the 7th to the 18th century.

title: MKT 597 Consulting Project in Marketing
description: Individual or team project solving real business problems for an existing business entity, domestic and/or international. Proposal, field research, analyses and oral and written presentations. Graded CR/NC

title: MDES 362 The International Relations of the Contemporary Middle East
description: Introduction to problems and issues in the Middle East today: religio-ethnic rivalries, conflicting nationalisms and ideologies, the Arab- Israeli conflict, Middle East oil.

title: MDES 363 Middle East Political Economy
description: Examination of general economic development issues: population, agriculture, industrialization, trade, oil, etc. Several Mideast case study countries are then explored in depth.

title: MKT 596 Research Practicum in Marketing
description: Hands-on practical experience working with a Marshall faculty member in the Marketing Department on an ongoing research project.

title: MKT 595 Internship in Marketing
description: Supervised on-the-job business experience in the field of marketing. (Curricular Practical Training.) Graded CR/NC.

title: MKT 593 Independent Research in Marketing
description: Independent research beyond normal course offerings. Proposal, research and written report/paper required.

title: MKT 592 Field Research in Marketing
description: Individual or team projects studying the marketing practices of an industry, company, government agency, country, geographic region, etc. Proposal, data collection, analyses, and written report. Graded CR/NC.

title: MKT 590 Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

title: MKT 589 CMO on Shareholder Value
description: Provide an understanding of the role of the Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) in a variety of industries and how he or she influences shareholder value.

title: MKT 586 Fashion, Luxury and Lifestyle Marketing
description: Examination of marketing issues and challenges within a variety of business settings in the fashion, luxury goods and lifestyle sectors in the global marketplace.

title: MKT 585 Marketing Radical Innovation
description: Study and application of new technology to create new business models, products, and services in world economies. Group projects focused on practical applications of concepts.

title: MKT 566 Marketing Analytics
description: Applications and models of marketing-related data analyses to the development of data-driven marketing strategies and making data-driven marketing decisions.

title: MKT 580 Fostering Creativity
description: An exploration of skills and practices (e.g., getting out of one's comfort zone, discovering one's inner-critic) necessary to develop and cultivate one's personal creativity.

title: MKT 536 Pricing Strategies
description: Introduction to the fundamentals of pricing and pricing strategy. Develop a conceptual framework and a set of analytical tools used to make sound pricing decisions.

title: MKT 560 Marketing Strategy
description: Design and implementation of marketing strategies applied to domestic and global business challenges that span multiple industries complimented by a consumer packaged goods marketing strategic plan project.

title: MKT 556 Internet Marketing
description: All aspects of Internet marketing. Internet as a tool for marketing communication, sales and distribution, customer management. Role of paid advertising, search engines, Website design.

title: MKT 543 Market Demand and Sales Forecasting
description: New product concept testing and life cycle forecasting, pricing and advertising response forecasting, consumer purchase intentions, judgmental marketing decision models, time series and regression analysis, computer methods.

title: MKT 565 Global Marketing
description: Variations in markets and trade patterns around the globe; product development and adaptation, pricing, promotion, and distribution issues across national cultures and international markets.

title: MKT 535 Business-to-Business Marketing Management
description: Business-to-business marketing strategies (as opposed to consumer targeted marketing) including product management, pricing, market sizing, and other issues of importance for professional marketers.

title: MKT 555 Marketing Channels
description: Examination of strategic decision making in marketing channels. Intensity of distribution, vertical integration, how roles are formulated, types of intermediaries, and multiple channels of distribution.

title: MKT 534 Retail Strategy
description: Frameworks for analysis of retail strategy and functions of a retail firm, including buying, merchandise management, pricing, promotion, and visual merchandising; application of concepts through case studies and student projects.

title: MKT 533 Branding Strategy
description: Comprehensive treatment of the behavioral foundations of brands and brand development. Exploration of alternative branding strategies and marketing tools for brand development.

title: MKT 531 Services Marketing Strategy
description: Analysis and development of sound marketing strategies and an integrated service management plan for service organizations. Examination of best practices among leading service providers.

title: MKT 526 Advertising and Social Media Strategy
description: Helps students understand advertising and social media; critique, develop, and test creative ads; place ads in media; and design, budget, and evaluate profitability of strategies.

title: MKT 528 Sales Management: The Art and Science of Sales
description: Emphasis on creating a sales strategy, planning and delivery of sales presentations, and techniques to persuade people to change their opinions in face-to-face meetings.

title: MKT 525 Consumer Behavior
description: Theories and applications of consumer behavior in marketing; psychological, social, cultural and ethnic factors influencing consumer behavior.

title: MKT 512 Customer Insights and Analysis
description: Use of marketing research techniques and technologies such as databases and statistical tools to collect, analyze and act upon customer information.

title: MKT 530 New Product Development
description: Systematic approach to product development and management; processes, techniques, and concepts firms use to develop, test, and introduce products and to manage products over their lifecycle.

title: MKT 465 Global Marketing Management
description: Product and service mix in multinational business; promotional alternatives; channel of distribution systems; pricing policies and legal barriers; multinational marketing opportunities; problems and information sources.

title: MKT 461 Marketing Blockbuster Entertainment
description: Examines the business of creating, marketing and managing massive entertainment franchises in movies and television with reference to video games and toys.

title: MKT 463 Pricing Strategies
description: Examination of role of pricing decisions; innovative pricing theories; Internet and technology impact on pricing, price negotiations, customized pricing, price image and reference prices.

title: MKT 499 Special Topics
description: Current developments in the field of Marketing; topics to be selected each semester.

title: MKT 450 Consumer Behavior and Marketing
description: Examines the relationship of consumer behavior to acquisition, usage, and disposition of products and the psychological, social and cultural influences that affect these decisions.

title: MKT 446L Practicum in New Product Development
description: Provides experience in a student managed product team. Work with R&D organization to design a new product or technology. Involves market research and implementation planning.

title: MKT 440 Marketing Analysis and Strategy
description: Synthesis of concepts and applications relating to the analysis of market opportunities and the development of product, promotion, distribution, pricing strategies. Recommended during student's final semesters.

title: MKT 445 New Product Development and Branding
description: This class examines how new product ideas are developed, test marketed, and, ultimately, brought to the marketplace. Issues about why new products fail and how brand images are managed in the marketplace are discussed. Legal aspects of brand management such as trademark protection and infringement are also addressed.

title: MKT 430 Retail Management
description: Introduction to the functions of retail management including location, buying, merchandise management, layout, pricing, and promotion; application of concepts to various retail institutions.

title: MKT 415 Sales Force Management
description: Studies the role of managing the selling function as part of the marketing mix; planning, implementing, and controlling sales force operations; critical issues in selecting, training, compensating and supervising salespeople.

title: MKT 425 Marketing in a Digital World
description: An introduction to the changing world of a connected consumer. Understanding consumer online, social media and mobile behavior using marketing analytics and strategic tools.

title: MKT 410 Professional Selling
description: Learn the principles of business to business selling and its function in marketing strategy and the marketing mix; explore professional selling as a career option.

title: MKT 406 Practicum in Advertising and Promotion Design
description: Provides real-life marketing experience as a member of a student managed marketing/advertising/promotions agency. Work with a client organization on the design of an advertising/promotions campaign. Requires market research, creative design, implementation planning, and client presentation.

title: MKT 405 Advertising and Promotion Management
description: Role of advertising in the marketing mix: determining objectives, strategies, and plans from situation analysis through research and creative processes, media selection, and sales promotion.

title: MKT 402 Research Skills for Marketing Insights
description: Creating and interpreting qualitative and quantitative research to gain insight into marketplace challenges, such as testing advertising, identifying new product opportunities, and understanding customer decisions.

Students are individually supervised by faculty. May not be taken until the student has completed at least one semester of enrollment in the graduate program with a cumulative 3.0 GPA.

description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

title: MICB 570 Microbiology Research Seminar
description: Critical discussion of current research topics. Students present published and unpublished research results for discussion and critique.

title: MICB 560 Recent Advances in Microbiology
description: Intensive examination of selected topics in microbiology. Student presentations and critiques. Required for all graduate students.

title: MICB 550 Microbial Pathogenesis
description: Critical discussion of recent developments in pathogenesis of select microbial, viral and parasitic agents with particular emphasis on molecular factors and their synergistic (antagonistic) actions.

title: MICB 549 Student Seminar Series
description: Microbiology students will present research seminars describing their thesis progress.

title: MICB 542 Animal Virology
description: Virus structure and chemistry; virus-cell interactions; aspects of virus genetics; molecular biology; pathogenesis, immunology, and evolution of viral infections.

title: MICB 503 Current Topics in Immunology
description: Discussion forum on the diverse areas of research which constitute modern immunology.

title: MICB 502 Molecular and Cellular Immunology
description: Specific topics to be scheduled on a yearly and rotating basis.

title: MICB 501 Introduction to Immunology
description: Basic introduction into molecular, cellular, and clinical immunology for second year medical students and graduate students in Microbiology.

title: MICB 500L Introductory Medical Microbiology
description: A survey of microorganisms which cause human infectious diseases including mechanisms of pathogenesis, principles of antibiotic usage, pertinent microbial genetics; lectures, laboratories and demonstrations.

title: MEDS 599 Special Topics
description: Lecture and discussion focused on specific topics within global medicine. Course topic will vary from semester to semester.

title: MEDS 597b Health Technology Internship
description: Internship course on the use of new technology based on sensors and wireless communications to the healthcare industry. Continues material from GM 597a.

title: MEDS 590 Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

title: MEDS 597a Health Technology Internship
description: Internship course on the use of new technology based on sensors and wireless communications to the healthcare industry.

title: MEDS 581 Case Studies in Interprofessional Healthcare
description: Survey of the specific roles each member of an interprofessional health team plays in the provision of care, based on their professional training. Application of diverse health professional expertise to case studies in healthcare.

title: MEDS 578 International Travel and Illness Prevention
description: Instruction in the prevention, identification, and treatment of common illnesses encountered in international travel. Includes instruction in basic health screening procedures and screening tool usage.

title: MEDS 580 Interprofessional Team Dynamics in Healthcare
description: Examination of typical composition and function of interprofessional healthcare teams. Exploration of roles of team members and purview of care issues and common challenges, including medication management, inpatient/outpatient decision making, and care plan implementation.

title: MEDS 577 Global Palliative Care
description: Exploration of the provision of palliative care and analysis of factors affecting the increased burden of palliative care provision facing developing regions of the world.

title: MEDS 576 Maternal and Child Health in South Africa
description: Examination of country-specific factors affecting pregnancy, pre-natal care, and childbirth in South Africa, with analysis of factors contributing to health inequality and methods to mitigate healthcare challenges.

title: MEDS 573 Global Health Entrepreneurship - Ideas into Innovations
description: Fundamentals of entrepreneurship applied to global health issues and programming including: idea conception, marketing, global health ethics, and other components related to business start-ups.

title: MEDS 574 Rural Health in South Africa
description: Two-week study abroad course exploring the complexities of the delivery of health care in rural South Africa.

title: MEDS 575 Introduction to Healthcare in Resource-Limited Settings
description: Introduction to tactics, tools, and directives commonly used in global health crises and resource-poor settings with an emphasis on strategic thinking and planning to enable situation-specific solutions to be implemented.

title: MEDS 572 Medicine in Film, Television, and the Media
description: Introduction to the role that film, television, and the media play in shaping public perceptions of health, including strategies to reach populations with medical insight in non-traditional ways.

title: MEDS 570 Introduction to Narrative Medicine
description: Introduction to the field of narrative medicine. Examination of theoretical and literary texts and the practice of narrative and reflective writing to enhance narrative competency and gain an understanding of the role of narrative in people's experiences with illness.

title: MEDS 571 Primary, Emergency, and Cancer Care in Urban Tanzania
description: Two-week study abroad course investigating the spectrum of healthcare, from basic primary care, through acute care, to specialty services, in urban Tanzania.

title: MICB 522 Infection and Host Responses
description: Overview of microbes, their life cycles and the host response they elicit, evade or exploit, including the manipulation and the malfunction of the immune system.

title: MEDS 567 Global Nutrition
description: A systematic survey of basic and clinical nutrition that provides an overview of critical public health-nutrition issues in both the developing world and industrial society.

title: MEDS 569 Interdisciplinary Medical Literature Evaluation
description: Focus on the importance of evidence-based practice in healthcare. Development of critical thinking and analysis of scientific literature to enable the identification and appropriate implementation of medical, cultural, and ethical interventions in healthcare, particularly through interdisciplinary collaboration.

title: MEDS 568 Global Issues: Aging
description: Examination of medical issues in aging through a nation-specific survey of how various countries treat the elderly in health policy and healthcare.

title: MEDS 563 Global Healthcare Development and Social Justice in Italy
description: A two-week course analyzing global healthcare access and delivery through the lens of development economics, social justice, health advocacy, and Italian medical history and research.

title: MEDS 560 Innovating in Healthcare in Malaysia
description: Two-week study abroad course in Malaysia that examines the capacity of local communities to address health needs and to address health priorities with innovation.

title: MEDS 566 Healthcare in Fiji
description: Two-week study abroad course in Fiji that examines the public health and healthcare systems of Fiji and its neighbors.

title: MEDS 564 Health Behavior and Healthcare in Germany
description: Two-week course that exposes students to public health and health systems infrastructure in Germany and Switzerland, including analysis of health behaviors.

title: MEDS 561 Global Healthcare Development and Practices in Nepal
description: Two-week course providing a multi-faceted understanding of the delivery of essential services to underserved populations, particularly women and children, in the challenging Nepalese healthcare landscape.

title: MEDS 558 Clinical Medicine and Translational Research in Argentina
description: Two week in-depth course examining and assessing the economic, social, political and unique health issues faced by the Latin- American Region especially Argentina.

title: MEDS 562 Healthcare in Thailand
description: Two-week course that provides students opportunities to analyze and gain exposure to public health and health systems infrastructure in Thailand.

title: MEDS 556 Global Health Field Study, New York
description: Two-week course providing students with a solid understanding of the United Nations' major agencies influential in global health, their mandate, their strengths and challenges. Includes field visit to selected UN organizations all located in NYC.

title: MPGU 145 Guitar Proficiency for the Pop Guitarist
description: Study of theory, technique and fingerboard organization of melodic and harmonic topics as applied to guitar for the beginner popular music student. Open to all music majors.

title: MEDS 557 Clinical Medicine and Healthcare Dynamics in Denmark
description: Two-week course that provides a venue for careful examination and assessment of the economic, social, political, and specific health issues currently faced by countries in the European Region.

title: MPGU 126 Easy Fingerstyle Beatles
description: Techniques of classical guitar applied to the study of five to eight Beatles songs, from "Hey Jude" to "Blackbird." No guitar or music background required.

title: MEDS 559 Clinical Medicine and Healthcare Determinants in China
description: A two-week intensive course abroad in Shanghai, China, focused on understanding clinical realities of Chinese medicine, health determinants and healthcare delivery.

title: MPGU 125 Beginning Fingerstyle/Chord Guitar
description: Basic fingerstyle guitar, learned through the study of such pieces as "Greensleeves," "Malaguena," and "Minuet" (Bach); song accompaniment patterns and music notation for the beginner.

title: MPGU 121 Intensive Beginning Pop/Rock Guitar
description: Introduction to the performance technique of pop/rock guitar as well as music theory fundamentals, exploring repertoire by artists such as The Beatles and Dave Matthews.

title: MPGU 120d Beginning Pop/Rock Guitar
description: Introduction to the performance technique of pop/rock guitar as well as music theory fundamentals, exploring repertoire by artists such as The Beatles and Dave Matthews.

title: MPGU 120a Beginning Pop/Rock Guitar
description: Introduction to the performance technique of pop/rock guitar as well as music theory fundamentals, exploring repertoire by artists such as The Beatles and Dave Matthews.

description: Individual instruction at the beginning level designed for non-music majors with no previous experience.

title: MPEM 754 Artist Diploma Performance
description: Individual instruction and related lab participation for Artist Diploma students.

title: MPEM 650 Collegium Directing
description: Practical training in the direction of a Collegium Musicum or other early music ensemble; program planning, repertory search and preparation, historical instrumentation and arranging, rehearsal procedure, improvisational techniques, and maintenance of instruments.

description: Individual or master class instruction for DMA Performance majors.
