title: EDUC 679 Blended Learning Experiences for Students in Urban Schools
description: Design, implement, and evaluate technology-rich learning environments to customize and individualize learning opportunities and assessments for K-12 students.

title: EDUC 428 The Effects of Curriculum and Institution on Early Childhood
description: The study of research, philosophy, and pedagogy that informs political, parents, community members, schools and their curriculum.

title: EDUC 678 Applying Knowledge and Strategies for Teaching All Students
description: , prepares candidates to apply curricular principals to lesson development and determine how content should be delivered to maximize learning.

title: EDUC 427 Vectors that Influence Early Childhood Development
description: Investigating early childhood issues from professional perspectives: historian, journalist, premedical, and law.

title: EDUC 677 Applications of Curriculum and Pedagogy, Part B
description: , prepares candidates to apply curricular principles to lesson development and determine how content should be delivered to maximize learning.

title: EDUC 676 Literacy Development and Instruction in Secondary Education
description: Prepares prospective secondary teachers to integrate literacy instruction within their content area by creating authentic opportunities for learners to develop literacy skills.

title: EDUC 426 Educational Inquiry
description: Introduction to the skills and knowledge required to be competent consumers and producers of education research. Students will be asked to design an educational study.

title: EDUC 425b Observation and Directed Teaching in Elementary Schools
description: Observation and experience in teaching under supervision in elementary schools (one semester at the kindergarten-primary level and one semester in the intermediate or upper grades).

title: EDUC 424a Curriculum and Methods in Elementary Education
description: Curriculum materials and teaching procedures in the elementary school.

title: EDUC 425a Observation and Directed Teaching in Elementary Schools
description: Observation and experience in teaching under supervision in elementary schools (one semester at the kindergarten-primary level and one semester in the intermediate or upper grades).

title: EDUC 424b Curriculum and Methods in Elementary Education
description: Curriculum materials and teaching procedures in the elementary school.

title: EDUC 422 Education for Social Change
description: Examines access to schooling and quality education across student difference indexed by race, class and gender.  Promotes understanding of U.S. public schooling for equitable outcomes.

title: EDUC 423 Unrealized Promise and Hope for Education in 21st Century
description: Investigates the promise of education and often-failed outcomes though the lens of literacy/language.  Focuses on literacy to promote student agency for successful educational attainment.

title: EDUC 421 Global Issues: Impact on Educational Outcomes
description: Situates U.S. education within the global context and examines the impact of global issues on national and international schooling in the 21st Century.

title: EDUC 419 Content to Pedagogy: P.E. for Elementary Students
description: Transformation of content in Physical Education to curriculum in the elementary classroom.

title: EDUC 418 Content to Pedagogy: From Social Sciences to Social Studies
description: Content, concepts, methods, and values for integrating the social sciences in the social studies.

title: EDUC 417 Content to Pedagogy: From Science Content to Science Curriculum
description: An overview of the goals and content of science instruction at the elementary level coupled with appropriate science curricular and pedagogical models.

title: EDUC 413 Methods and Models of Instruction for Language Minority Students
description: Curriculum materials and teaching strategies for use in successfully teaching language minority students in both elementary and secondary schools.

title: EDUC 416 Content to Pedagogy: Art in the Elementary School
description: Transformation of content in art to curriculum in the elementary classroom.

title: EDUC 415 Content to Pedagogy: Mathematics in the Elementary School
description: Bridging college level mathematics content and elementary school curricula to design developmentally appropriate mathematics instruction.

title: EDUC 410 The Teaching of Reading and Writing
description: Analysis of reading/writing processes; methods/materials for teaching literacy in elementary schools; issues in biliteracy and instruction; classroom observation/participation in small-group instruction. Admission to the major.

title: EDUC 412 Instructional Methods in TESOL
description: Introduction to approaches in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages and methods for teaching reading, writing, listening, speaking, along with a practical fieldwork component.

title: EDUC 411 Foundation of TESOL
description: Introduction to the ways in which sociocultural context, language systems and acquisition influence English language learning and teaching.

title: EDUC 409 Foundations of Language Education
description: Overview of research and current theories in bilingual, second language, and foreign language instruction.

title: EDUC 675 Literacy Development and Instruction in Elementary Education
description: Literacy development and instruction, with a focus on the importance of literacy for academic success and civic participation.

title: EDUC 210 Breaking the Code of College Success
description: Examination and application of research-based self-regulation and learning strategies to increase performance outcomes in any academic subject.

title: DES 102 Design Fundamentals
description: Introduction to the basic elements and processes of visual communication and design. Instruction includes studio projects, lectures and readings. Various media used.

title: ENST 599 Special Topics
description: Subjects specifically relevant to an environmental studies field, sometimes conducted as intensive short courses.

title: ENST 594b Master's Thesis
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: ENST 594z Master's Thesis
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: ENST 594a Master's Thesis
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: ENST 590 Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

title: ENST 520 Environmental Law and Policy
description: Introduces students to the central issues, concepts, and theories in environmental law and policy and analyzes present environmental laws and regulations.

title: EDUC 392 Undergraduate Research Methods
description: Examines processes of scholarly research; quantitative and qualitative research methods; faculty mentorship; experiential learning; research proposal writing; careers in research. Sophomore or junior standing in the major. Departmental approval.

title: ENST 540 California Coastal Zone Science and Policy
description: Science and policy issues used to characterize and manage California coastal resources. Key issues include: coastal pollution, public health, ecosystem management, and marine reserves.

title: ENST 505b Advanced Environmental Science Seminar
description: Ties together science, technology, and finance with risk assessment and policy.

title: ENST 510 Statistics for Environmental Analysis
description: This course introduces graduate students to the various quantitative techniques and methodological approaches used in pollution control, natural resources management, and environmental protection.

title: ENST 530 Environmental Risk Analysis
description: Analyzes various potential environmental risks and examines how science, government, and business measure and prepare for environmental risks.

title: ENST 504 Environmental Science Seminar II
description: . A series of biweekly guest lectures on critical scientific principles, concepts, and issues related to pollution control, remediation, and ecology.

title: ENST 505a Advanced Environmental Science Seminar
description: Ties together science, technology, and finance with risk assessment and policy.

title: ENST 502 Environmental Science Seminar I
description: A series of biweekly guest lectures on critical scientific principles, concepts, and issues related to pollution control, remediation, and ecology.

title: ENST 503 Environmental Science II
description: . Exposes students to critical scientific principles, concepts, and issues related to pollution control, remediation, and ecology.

title: ENST 501 Environmental Science I
description: Exposes students to critical scientific principles, concepts, and issues related to pollution control, remediation, and ecology.

title: ENST 595 Graduate Seminar in Environmental Studies
description: Addresses the obstacles to environmental policymaking and management by examining the interrelationships between science, technology, and social science.

title: ENST 500 Interdisciplinary Approaches to Environmental Studies
description: Students will develop advanced skills to address complex environmental issues that society faces today. Different approaches for studying environmental processes and resources will be examined.

title: ENST 499 Special Topics
description: Selected topics dealing with environmental issues and problems.

title: ENST 495 Senior Seminar in Environmental Studies
description: Students form multidisciplinary teams and are asked to study and resolve a major environmental problem facing a particular region or target population.

title: ENST 492 Directed Environmental Policy and Science Internship
description: Provides opportunities for professional development in environmental policy and science and prepares students for career or graduate school in environmental-related fields. Students are placed in internships and guided before and during the internship period. Students gain practical experience and learn how government and nongovernmental organizations pursue and implement environmental policy and science work.

title: ENST 490x Directed Research
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: EE 569 Introduction to Digital Image Processing
description: Image sampling, 2-D image transform, image enhancement, geometric image modification, morphologic processing, edge detection, texture analysis, image filtering and restoration.

title: EE 566 Optical Information Processing
description: Coherent and incoherent optical transforming, imaging and two-dimensional information processing systems; optical image processing, spatial frequency response and filtering; optical and digital holography.

title: EE 565 Information Theory and Compression
description: Entropy and mutual information. Variable and fixed-length, lossless and lossy compression. Universal compression. Text and multimedia compression. Channel capacity. Error-correcting codes. Erasure and Gaussian channels.

title: EE 563 Estimation Theory
description: Parameter estimation and state estimation technique including: least squares, BLUE, maximum-likelihood, maximum a posteriori, Kalman-prediction, Kalman-filtering and Kalman smoothing and extended Kalman filtering.

title: EE 564 Digital Communication and Coding Systems
description: Digital modulations. Optimal reception. Performance analysis. Classical and modern codes. Viterbi, forward-backward, and iterative decoding. Practical designs for channels with memory or nonlinearities. Example systems.

title: EE 567 Communication Systems
description: Analysis of communication systems operating from very low to optical frequencies. Comparison of modulation and detection methods. System components description. Optimum design of communication systems.

title: ENST 485 Role of the Environment in the Collapse of Human Societies
description: Field studies in the roles of environmental problems in the collapse of ancient civilizations and analogous problems facing contemporary populations in those same places.

title: ENST 480 Integrated Ecosystem Management in Micronesia
description: Field studies in ecosystem management tools used to investigate complex environmental problems in Micronesia. Historical, cultural, and scientific topics, direct observations of biological, physical, and chemical conditions.

title: ENST 440 Environmental Risk Assessment
description: Assesses various potential environmental risks and examines how science, government, business, and industry measure and prepare for environmental risks.

title: ENST 442 Global Climate Change: Policy and Society
description: Examines climate change policy at the international, national, state, and local levels, and explores the role civil society plays in climate change politics.

title: ENST 432 Environment and Governance: International and National Policy
description: Exposes students to policy makers and major institutions that work closely with local decision makers towards developing environmental policy framework.

title: ENST 410 Water and Energy Management in the Asia-Pacific Region
description: An exploration of how the essential resources of water and energy are managed in the Asia-Pacific region and the implications of such management.

title: ENST 390 Special Problems
description: Supervised, individual studies. No more than one registration permitted. Enrollment by petition only.

title: ENST 387 Economics for Natural Resources and the Environment
description: An introduction to the economic tools and issues that affect natural resource use and environmental management.

title: ENST 370 Marine and Coastal Environmental Policy
description: Survey of major environmental policies both international and domestic as they relate to fisheries, shipping, pollution, seaports and coastal management.

title: EE 562 Random Processes in Engineering
description: Random vectors, sequences, and functions. Linear transformations, second moment theory, spectral densities, narrowband processes, Gaussian processes, correlation detection, linear minimum mean square error estimation.

title: EE 560L Digital System Design
description: ASIC design, FPGAs, VHDL, verilog, test benches, simulation, synthesis, timing analysis, post-synthesis simulation, FIFOs, handshaking, memory interface, PCI bus protocol, CAD tools, design lab exercises.

title: EE 557 Computer Systems Architecture
description: Computer architecture from a design perspective: Pipelined processors, speculative execution, VLIW, vector processors, GPU/GPGPU, memory technology and systems, interconnection networks, shared-memory and message-passing multiprocessors, chip multiprocessors.

title: EE 558 Optical Fiber Communication Systems
description: State-of-the-art optical fiber communication systems. Emphasis on optoelectronic-device and communication-systems issues necessary to provide high-speed and/or networked optical communications.

title: EE 559 Mathematical Pattern Recognition
description: Distribution free classification, discriminant functions, training algorithms; statistical classification, parametric and nonparametric techniques; artificial neural networks.

title: EE 554 Real Time Computer Systems
description: Structure of real-time computer systems; analog signals and devices; scheduling, synchronization of multiprocessors; reliability, availability; serial/parallel computations; real-time operating systems and languages; design examples.

title: EE 555 Broadband Network Architectures
description: Broadband network architectures and services, technologies for high-speed access and core networks, optical infrastructure for layered network architectures, high performance switch and router architectures.

title: EE 552 Asynchronous VLSI Design
description: Asynchronous channels and architectures; implementation design styles; controller synthesis; hazards, and races; Petri-nets; performance analysis, and optimization; globally asynchronous locally synchronous design.

title: EE 553 Computational Solution of Optimization Problems
description: Computer algorithms for system optimization. Search techniques, gradient methods, parameter optimization in control systems. Optimization with constraints; linear and nonlinear programming. Random search techniques.

title: EE 551 Principles of Radar
description: Signal propagation, reflections from targets; radar equation; detection of scintillating targets; resolution; ambiguity functions; clutter rejection; tracking radars.

title: EE 549 Nanotechnology for Materials, Electronics, and Circuits
description: Nanotechnology for advanced nanomaterials, nanoelectronics devices, and circuits, including the rigorous treatment of electronic band structures of carbon nanotubes, graphene, and two-dimensional materials.

title: EE 546 Mathematics of High-Dimensional Data
description: Modern developments in data representation/analysis, nonconvex optimization, high-dimensional probability, sketching, clustering, low-rank models, inverse problems, applications in imaging, machine learning, computer vision and neuroscience.

title: EE 550 Design and Analysis of Computer Communication Networks
description: Applications of stochastic modeling and optimization techniques to communication network design and analysis. Data link control; performance models; multi-access channels; routing and flow control.

title: EE 543bL Digital Control Systems
description: Modeling of real processes; design and implementation of digital control systems in the controls laboratory.

title: EE 542 Internet and Cloud Computing
description: Principles and technologies of server clusters, virtualized datacenters, Grids/P2P, Internet clouds, social networks, Internet of Things (IoT), and their innovative applications.

title: EE 543aL Digital Control Systems
description: Design, analysis, and implementation of digital control systems using microcomputers; Z-transform methods; frequency domain and state space approach; computational aspects; sampling and quantization.

title: EE 544 Radio Frequency Systems and Hardware
description: Elements of radio frequency communication systems: modulation/demodulation strategies, transmission-channel impairments, performance criteria, hardware (low-noise amplifiers, mixers, oscillators), digital back-end, contemporary case studies.

title: EE 541 Radio Frequency Filter Design
description: Theory and realization of passive and transconductancebased active filters for radio frequency communications. Distributed and quasi-distributed passive filters. Circuit testing via scattering parameters.

title: ENST 344 Environmental Ethics
description: Explores issues concerning behavior of humans towards the nonhuman world. Examines a wide spectrum of ethical issues.

title: ENST 320b Water and Soil Sustainability; Energy and Air Sustainability
description: Overview of issues related to water and soil sustainability including science, policy and business aspects.

title: EE 540 Introduction to Quantum Electronics
description: Fundamentals of light amplification; laser amplifiers and oscillators; atomic pumping; maser and laser systems; definitions of coherence; measurements in quantum electronics.

title: ENST 320a Water and Soil Sustainability; Energy and Air Sustainability
description: Overview of issues related to water and soil sustainability including science, policy and business aspects.

title: ENST 298bL Introduction to Scientific Diving
description: Extensive academic preparation in the physics, physiology, safety, and methodology for in-water scientific diving.

title: ENST 310 Sustainable Fisheries Management
description: Examination of scientific, social, political, and economic factors of fisheries management, engaging students in key issues of coastal and marine sustainability.

title: ENST 298aL Introduction to Scientific Diving
description: Extensive academic preparation in the physics, physiology, safety, and methodology for in-water scientific diving.

title: ENST 150gx Environmental Issues in Society
description: Exploration of the major social, political, economic, religious, and philosophical disagreements that exist between scholars, leaders, and citizens concerning today's most serious environmental issues and problems.

title: ENST 100g Introduction to Environmental Studies
description: Gateway to the majors and minors in Environmental Studies. Provides students with an overview of how government agencies and societal institutions address (or fail to address) the interrelated social and scientific aspects of environmental problems and policies.

title: ENGR 599 Special Topics
description: Current developments in the field of engineering; topics to be selected each semester.

title: ENGR 597x Internship in Engineering with Professional Writing and Communication
description: Registration Restriction: Open only to master students in engineering

title: EE 548 Analytical Methods in Robotics
description: Homogeneous transformations; formal description of robot manipulators; kinematic equations and their solution; differential relationships; dynamics; control; static forces; compliance.

title: ENGR 596 Internship in Engineering
description: Part-time or full-time, practical work experience in the student's field of study. The internship must be located at an off-campus facility. Students are individually supervised by faculty. May not be taken until the student has completed at least one semester of enrollment in the graduate program.

title: ENGR 598 Professional Internship Experiences
description: Part-time or full-time practical work experience in a particular field of study. The internship must be located at an off-campus facility.

title: ENGR 595z Professional Writing and Communication for Internships
description: Focus on writing and communication skills for master's students pursuing a professional internship.

title: ENGR 595d Professional Writing and Communication for Internships
description: Focus on writing and communication skills for master's students pursuing a professional internship.

title: ENGR 595c Professional Writing and Communication for Internships
description: Focus on writing and communication skills for master's students pursuing a professional internship.

title: ENGR 595b Professional Writing and Communication for Internships
description: Focus on writing and communication skills for master's students pursuing a professional internship.

title: ENGR 595a Professional Writing and Communication for Internships
description: Focus on writing and communication skills for master's students pursuing a professional internship.

title: EE 537 Modern Solid-State Devices
description: Integrated-circuit technologies for mixed-signal communication and data systems. Constituent device models and their limitations. Contemporary research topics.

title: EE 536b Mixed-Signal Integrated Circuit Design
description: Non-linear integrated circuits, data-converter architectures and implementations, comprehensive design project.

title: EE 538 Bio-Inspired and Nanoscale Integrated Computing
description: Quantum Dot Cellular Automata, Spin-wave Architectures, Molecular Computing, DNA Computing, Carbon Nanotubes, and Medical Nanorobotics.

title: EE 535 Mobile Communications
description: The mobile communication channel; techniques used to combat the channel; cellular communications; multiple-access techniques; example mobile communication systems.

title: EE 536a Mixed-Signal Integrated Circuit Design
description: MOSFET operation and models; elementary amplifier configurations; biasing and references; frequency response; noise; feedback; operational amplifiers; frequency compensation; non-linearity and mismatch; passive and active filters.

title: EE 531 Nonlinear Optics
description: Theory of nonlinear optical susceptibility and application to self-focusing, harmonic generation, and parametric interactions. Raman and Brillouin scattering. Coherent spectroscopy.

title: EE 533 Network Processor Design and Programming
description: Understanding of network processor architecture, applications, and other relevant issues. Program network processor and test under realistic network environment. Design and deploy custom network processor.

title: EE 532 Wireless Internet and Pervasive Computing
description: Wireless Internet access technologies, 3G cellular systems, WAP and PKI protocols, mobile computing devices, network security for mobile E-commerce, software and middleware for pervasive, cluster, grid, and Internet computing.

title: EE 528 Power Electronics
description: Fundamentals of switched-mode power converters operating under steadystate and transient conditions. Feedback control systems. Magnetic circuit design.

title: EE 529 Optics
description: Geometrical optics, electromagnetic wave propagation, reflection and refraction at interfaces, imaging with lenses and mirrors, optics of the eye, optical instruments (microscopes/telescopes/cameras), and polarization.

title: EE 530 Optical Materials, Instruments and Devices
description: Anisotropic materials and devices; properties of metals; design and theory of selected optical instruments; properties of electrooptic, acoustooptic, and spatial light modulators; optical detectors.

title: EE 526 Renewable Energy in Power Systems
description: Renewable energy sources and their integration in electrical networks. Power-flow control from highly variable resources. Cost analysis and planning.

title: EE 525 Power System Protection
description: Theory of system and equipment protection, characteristics of relays, relay coordination, and system considerations.

title: EE 524 Transients in Power Systems
description: Overvoltages during faults, voltage recovery, arcing faults, restrikes, theory of switching surges. Systems grounding, traveling waves, lightning and surge protection, insulation coordination.

title: EE 527 Net-Centric Power-System Control
description: Control and stability of large-scale systems such as the electric power grid. Integration with information networks.

title: EE 522 Immersive Audio Signal Processing
description: Fundamentals of digital audio signal processing, room acoustics, and psychoacoustics. Algorithms for real-time implementation of immersive audio systems for integrated media applications.

title: EE 521 Power Systems Analysis and Design
description: Power system planning, studies, and design; time-domain modeling and analysis of power-system networks; power flow, stability, fault, and economic dispatch analysis; symmetrical components.

title: EE 520 Introduction to Quantum Information Processing
description: Introduces the basics of quantum computation and quantum information theory: quantum bits and registers, unitary gates, algorithms, error correction, and quantum cryptography.

title: EE 518 Mathematics and Tools for Financial Engineering
description: Students will build a mathematical background for studying financial engineering. Emphasis is on analysis, proofs and examples. Mathwork's financial toolbox will be introduced.

title: EE 519 Speech Recognition and Processing for Multimedia
description: Speech production, acoustics, perception, synthesis, compression, recognition, transmission. Coding for speech, music, and CD-quality. Feature extraction. Echo cancellation. Audio, visual synchronization. Multimedia, internet use.

title: EE 517 Statistics and Data Analysis for Engineers
description: Statistics and data analysis emphasizing computation and problem solving: confidence intervals, hypothesis tests, bootstrap and Monte Carlo estimation, regression, Bayesian and statistical learning techniques.

title: ENGR 503x Oral Communication Skills for Engineering PhD Students
description: Academic and professional presentation skills for PhD students. Preparation for qualifying exams, conference paper presentations, and other forms of oral communication. Use of visual aids and poster displays included.

title: ENGR 504x Fellowship Proposal Writing for Engineering PhD Students
description: Preparation of essays and other materials for research fellowship applications. Open only to PhD engineering students.

title: ENGR 502x Writing Skills for Engineering PhD Students
description: Writing of engineering curriculum- and research-related projects for PhD students. Focus is on conference papers, dissertations and proposals, journal articles, and other forms.

title: ENGR 501x Engineering Writing and Communication for Master's Students
description: Academic and discipline-specific writing skills. Emphasis on structure of discourse and writing process. Presentation and oral communication skills also addressed.

title: ENGR 509 Patent Law for Scientists and Engineers
description: Tools for engineering and science graduate students to make informed decisions about obtaining and enforcing patent protection for their future inventions: validity, infringement, unenforceability.

title: ENGR 499 Special Topics
description: Current developments in the field of engineering.

title: ENGR 493x Dean's Seminar in Entrepreneurship
description: Overview of starting and developing a new business. Discussions with successful business leaders and entrepreneurs. Not available for students admitted to the Entrepreneur Program. Open only to seniors or graduate students in business or engineering.

title: ENGR 471b Interdisciplinary Capstone Design
description: A culminating experience in applying technical skills they have acquired in their engineering coursework to solve a design problem sponsored by an external customer.

title: ENGR 461 Engineering Economics and Technology Development​
description: Introduction to the theory and practice of engineering economics in the context of technology development.

title: ENGR 471a Interdisciplinary Capstone Design
description: A culminating experience in applying technical skills they have acquired in their engineering course work to solve a design problem sponsored by an external customer.

title: ENGR 400 Engineering Honors Project
description: Supervised interdisciplinary studies and projects. Enrollment limited to members of the Viterbi School of Engineering Honors Program.

title: ENGR 401x Communicating Science and Engineering to Children
description: Engineering students communicate their knowledge, collaborate constructively with peers, and inspire underserved children to develop a curiosity and persistence for science and engineering.

title: ENGR 395dx Cooperative Education Work Experience
description: Supervised work experience in a professional environment related to a specific degree program, academic level, and career objective. Acceptance into Cooperative Education Program required.

title: ENGR 395bx Cooperative Education Work Experience
description: Supervised work experience in a professional environment related to a specific degree program, academic level, and career objective. Acceptance into Cooperative Education Program required.

title: ENGR 395cx Cooperative Education Work Experience
description: Supervised work experience in a professional environment related to a specific degree program, academic level, and career objective. Acceptance into Cooperative Education Program required.

title: ENGR 345 Principles and Practices of Global Innovation
description: Learner-centered, cross-cultural, technology-enabled approaches to principles and industrial practices leveraging cultural diversity to inspire innovations for competitive global markets. Requires an extended semester of 22 weeks, including 2-week overseas project in early summer.

title: ENGR 395ax Cooperative Education Work Experience
description: Supervised work experience in a professional environment related to a specific degree program, academic level, and career objective. Acceptance into Cooperative Education Program required.

title: ENGR 305 Engineering Biology Matters
description: Engineering students will learn biological phenomena in the context of engineering principles and explore biological mechanisms and processes as analogies for designing engineered systems.

title: ENGR 102 Engineering Freshman Academy
description: Introduction to the profession of engineering. Ethical, political and societal consequences of engineering innovations and the impact of engineering on everyday life. Team projects and guest lectures. Open to freshmen only.

title: ENGR 150L Engineering Science and Systems: From Humans to Robots
description: Hands-on multidisciplinary engineering course that uses robotics as a theme to cover material from all areas of engineering. Laboratory; programming; team projects; end-of-semester exhibition. Open only to freshmen.

title: EE 515 High-Voltage Technology
description: High voltage engineering basic concepts; theoretical, design, and practical aspects of overvoltages, travelling-waves, insulation, and aging; breakdown mechanisms; insulation coordination.

title: EE 516 High-Voltage DC Transmission Systems
description: AC/DC conversion processes, converter technologies, and design; harmonics, controls, and protection; AC/DC interactions and system performance; modeling, application, and installation; current-source versus voltage-source converters.

title: EE 513 Solid State Energy Devices
description: Design and operation of solar photovoltaic energy converters, thermovoltoic energy converters, thermoelectric energy converters, and solid state light emitters; their roles in renewal and conservation of energy.

title: EE 514 Quantum Error Correction
description: A comprehensive introduction to quantum error correction and decoherence control, from the basics to the cutting edge, enabling students to delve into current research topics.

title: EE 512 Stochastic Processes
description: Probability theory and stochastic processes, including renewal theory, Markov chains, Brownian motion, martingales, and stochastic calculus. Applications in communication networks, queuing theory, and financial systems.

title: EE 511 Simulation Methods for Stochastic Systems
description: Project-oriented investigation of simulation methods used for the analysis and design of complex stochastic systems whose operation and performance are affected by random events.

title: EE 509 Electromagnetics for Semiconductor Photonics
description: Overview of electromagnetics needed to understand and design photonic devices. Includes discussion of waveguides and resonant cavities and an introduction to photonic crystals.

title: EE 510 Linear Algebra for Engineering
description: Introduction to linear algebra and matrix theory and their underlying concepts; applications to engineering problems; mathematically rigorous and foundational to other classes in communication, control, and signal processing.

title: EE 504L Solid-State Processing and Integrated Circuits Laboratory
description: Laboratory oriented with lectures keyed to practical procedures and processes. Solid-state fabrication and analysis fundamentals; basic device construction techniques.

title: EE 505 Analog, Mixed-Signal, and RF Integrated-Circuit Tape-Out
description: Complete systematic tape-out flow including schematic design, simulation, layout, and post-layout verification of analog, mixed-signal, or radio-frequency integrated circuits.

title: EE 503 Probability for Electrical and Computer Engineers
description: Rigorous coverage of probability, discrete and continuous random variables, functions of multiple random variables, covariance, correlation, random sequences, Markov chains, estimation, and introduction to statistics.

title: ENGR 101 Introduction to Engineering
description: Gateway to the majors and minors in engineering. Introduction to engineering disciplines. Historical and current trends in engineering; ethical and societal factors in engineering solutions. Hands-on design experiences; USC laboratory tours.

title: EE 500 Neural Learning and Computational Intelligence
description: Computational intelligence techniques that include neural systems, deep learning, adaptive pattern classification, fuzzy function approximation, simulated annealing and evolutionary computing, and hybrid systems.

title: EDUC 674 Identifying and Teaching to Student Differences
description: , course proceeds with greater focus on learner behavior, ability, and language to access strategies to differentiate, scaffold, and assess learning.

title: EDUC 671 Contexts for Educational Equity, Access, and Agency
description: Examines how environmental, pedagogical, and curricular choices can be cultivated with greater knowledge of culture, gender, orientation, race, learning differences and language.

title: EDUC 673 Applications of Curriculum and Pedagogy, Part A
description: Candidates apply content-area knowledge utilizing a repertoire of pedagogical practices responsive to the needs and interests of diverse learners.

title: EDUC 672 Integrated Language Development Across the Curriculum
description: Understanding of language development and the connection between language and learning in school, across all curricular areas.

title: EDUC 670 Introduction to Curriculum and Pedagogy in Urban Schools
description: General introduction to curriculum and instruction (pedagogy) affecting teaching and learning across disciplines, grade levels, and different social contexts of schooling.

title: EDUC 661 Equity in College and Career Access
description: Focus on College and Career Readiness using an equity lens with a foundation in the relevant theories, conceptual frameworks and issues.

title: EDUC 660a Clinical Practice Seminar in Language Teaching
description: First of two-course series focused on helping students translate theory to practice. Designed for students completing fieldwork required for the teaching credential.

title: EDUC 660b Clinical Practice Seminar in Language Teaching
description: Second of two-course series focused on helping students translate theory to practice. Part B also facilitates preparation for and submission of the EdTPA.

title: EDUC 657 Social Foundations of Research
description: Foundations in social science research with exposure to broad cross-section of research methods, design, and analytical techniques. Open only to doctoral students.

title: EDUC 659 Introduction to Causal Inference in Educational Settings
description: An introduction to quasi- and non-experimental methods researchers use to strengthen causal linkages between educational policies and reforms, and student, teacher, and other outcomes.

title: EDUC 656 Applied Linguistics for English Language Educators
description: Introduction to systems of English language and language in use. Contrasts systems of English to other languages to identify issues of interest for language teachers.

title: EDUC 655 Social Foundations of Language Education
description: Candidates engage in systematic study of the social aspects of language learning and their significance for structuring learning opportunities for diverse students in language classrooms.

title: EDUC 653 Advanced Qualitative Research
description: Interactive seminar that explores the theoretical underpinnings and practicalities of interviews, portraiture, focus groups, life histories, and cultural biographies.

title: EDUC 654 Advanced Qualitative Research Methods II
description: Designed to follow Advanced Qualitative Research, focuses on data analysis in the qualitative research tradition, writing and publishing from qualitative data.

title: EDUC 658 Hierarchical Linear Models
description: Application of two- and three-level multilevel models in educational settings, fixed and random effects, growth models.

title: EDUC 651 Introduction to Qualitative Research Methods
description: Introduces qualitative methodologies, qualitative data collection and analysis techniques, support in drafting research proposals, and paradigms on how to critically think about inquiry.

title: EDUC 652 Inquiry Methods III
description: Logic and methods of qualitative data analysis in the examination of educational issues and the framing of solutions for them.

title: EDUC 650 Ways of Seeing: Applying Social Science and Critical Theories to Education
description: Examines the intersections of inequality and education, focusing on how each disciplinary perspective outlines a logic for change.

title: EE 499 Special Topics
description: Course content will be selected each semester from current developments in the field of electrical engineering.

title: EE 496 Capstone Design
description: Capstone design project for the undergraduate degree. Project topics vary from semester to semester.

title: EE 494a Undergraduate Thesis
description: For the undergraduate degree. Credit on acceptance of thesis.  IP (EE 494a) or letter grade (EE 494b).

title: EE 494b Undergraduate Thesis
description: For the undergraduate degree. Credit on acceptance of thesis. IP (EE 494a) or letter grade (EE 494b).

title: EE 490x Directed Research
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: EE 492a Undergraduate Project
description: For the undergraduate degree. Credit on acceptance of project. In Progress (IP) (EE 492a) or letter grade (EE 492b).

title: EE 492b Undergraduate Project
description: For the undergraduate degree. Credit on acceptance of project. In Progress (IP) (

title: ENDO 711 Alternatives in Endodontics
description: Alternative endodontic techniques presented by guest clinicians. Emphasis on endodontics and its relationship with periodontal, restorative, and surgical disciplines.

title: ENDO 710 Seminar: Endodontic Practice Management
description: Organizing, staffing, and evaluation of an endodontic practice. Modes and patterns of management including use of auxiliaries. Emphasis on endodontistgeneral practitioner relationship; legal aspects of dental practice.

title: ENDO 705b Seminar: Endodontic Case Presentation
description: Student presentation of cases for critique and analysis.

title: EDUC 649 Teaching Practice to Support Language Learners
description: Introduces components of effective teaching, including lesson and unit planning, creating a classroom environment conducive to learning, and classroom management strategies.

title: EDUC 646a Marriage and Family Therapy Capstone: Leadership Project
description: An evidencebased leadership project, designed to enhance fieldwork site functioning. Includes needs assessment, literature review, project design, implementation, and evaluation.

title: EDUC 648b Apprenticeship in School Administration and Leadership
description: Supervised field experience in administrative areas of K–12 schools. Development of Administrative Services Portfolio.

title: EDUC 646b Marriage and Family Therapy Capstone: Leadership Project
description: An evidencebased leadership project, designed to enhance fieldwork site functioning. Includes needs assessment, literature review, project design, implementation, and evaluation.

title: EDUC 648a Apprenticeship in School Administration and Leadership
description: Supervised field experience in administrative areas of K–12 schools. Development of Administrative Services Portfolio.

title: EDUC 647 School Leadership Seminar
description: Planning, design, and development of an action research plan for school improvement using multiple measures of project assessment.

title: EDUC 643 Advancing Community Support through Social Media
description: Use of social media to communicate school vision. Incorporating objectives, strategies, assessment, and accountability measures in communication plans.

title: EDUC 645a Fieldwork in Counseling
description: Duplicates Credit in former EDCO 561.

title: EDUC 645b Fieldwork in Counseling
description: Duplicates Credit in former EDCO 561.

title: EDUC 642 Controversies in Learning and Instruction
description: An introduction to learning research and theory, issues in learning and educational psychology situated in the context of diverse, urban settings. Open to students admitted to the PhD only.

title: EDUC 640 The Research University in the 21st Century
description: An examination of the current transformation of the American research university with a focus on key issues that confront academics who work in research universities. Open to students admitted to the PhD only.

title: EDUC 641 Human Capital and School Organization
description: School leadership, organization, management and development of school personnel. Capitalizing on school resources to meet school goals.

title: EDUC 644 Practicum in Counseling
description: Supervised clinical work with clients, including adults, couples, children, and families.

title: EDUC 638 Cross-Cultural Counseling: Research and Practice
description: An examination of the cultural, socioeconomic, and language factors that may affect culturally differentiated populations; alternative crosscultural counseling approaches.

title: EDUC 639 Approaches and Strategies for Language Teaching
description: Overview of approaches, models and strategies in language teaching, topics include lesson planning, and implementation of the lesson for language and content area instruction.

title: EDUC 633 Child and Elder Abuse and Domestic Violence
description: A review of laws governing mandated reporting of child and elder abuse, the procedures involved, as well as etiology, effects, and treatment interventions.

title: EDUC 636 Perspectives on Human Sexuality
description: The physiological-psychological and socio-cultural variables associated with sexual identity and sexual behavior with an emphasis upon sexual dysfunctions.

title: EDUC 632 Technology in Higher Education
description: The integration of technology in higher education and the relationship to quality of teaching, access to learners, and cost-effectiveness for universities and colleges.

title: EDUC 635 Psychotherapy with Children and Adolescents
description: Training in unique diagnostic considerations in working with children and adolescents. Exposure to empirically supported treatment modalities for children and adolescents.

title: EDUC 631 Locating Educational Performance Problems
description: Development and implementation of strategies for locating, solving and evaluating solutions to performance problems in educational organizations. Open only to doctoral students.

title: EDUC 637 Group Counseling: Theory and Process
description: Theory, research, and practice of group counseling. Includes laboratory experience.

title: EDUC 634 Couples Counseling
description: Examines relational development and change, strategies for intervention with couples, and selected issues in couples relationship functioning.

title: EE 482 Linear Control Systems
description: Analysis of linear control systems; continuous and sampleddata systems, various stability criteria; frequency response and root locus compensation techniques.

title: EE 484x Communication System Design
description: Design and analysis of analog and digital communication systems. System models, requirements, development, performance analysis and component selection techniques. Comprehensive system design project. Capstone design experience.

title: EE 483 Introduction to Digital Signal Processing
description: Fundamentals of digital signal processing covering: discrete time linear systems, quantization, sampling, Z-transforms, Fourier transforms, FFTs and filter design.

title: EE 479 Analog Integrated Circuit Design
description: MOSFET and BJT operation and models; elementary amplifier configurations; biasing and references; frequency response; feedback; operational amplifiers.

title: EE 477L MOS VLSI Circuit Design
description: Analysis and design of digital MOS VLSI circuits including area, delay and power minimization. Laboratory assignments including design, layout, extraction, simulation and automatic synthesis.

title: EE 474 Introduction to Photonics
description: Photonic system requirements; waveguide modes and dispersion; optical fiber modes, loss and dispersion; principles of operation of lasers, optical amplifiers, detectors and modulators; noise.

title: EE 475 Wireless Communication Technology
description: Fundamentals of wireless communication from a device point of view. Lab experiments and design project.

title: EE 470 Electromagnetics II
description: Dynamic field theory and elementary solutions to Maxwell's equations. Introduction to propagation and radiation of electromagnetic fields.

title: EE 467 Introduction to Communication Systems
description: Analog and digital communication systems. (De)modulation and (de)multiplexing of AM/FM/PM, noise, digital data formats, error rates, and spectral analysis. Review of wireless, networking, and optical systems.

title: EE 457 Computer Systems Organization
description: Register Transfer level machine organization; performance; arithmetic; pipelined processors; exceptions, out-of-order and speculative execution, cache, virtual memory, multi-core multi-threaded processors, cache coherence.

title: EE 459Lx Embedded Systems Design Laboratory
description: Specification, design, implementation, testing and documentation of a digital system project using embedded processors, programmable logic, analog I/O interfaces and application specific hardware. Capstone design experience.

title: EE 454L Introduction to System-on-Chip
description: Design flow, tools, and issues related to System/Network-on-Chip (S/Noc) design for real-time embedded systems with applications in mobile, cloud, aerospace, and medical electronics.

title: EE 453 Computing Platforms and Paradigms
description: Microarchitecture performance, storage technologies, FPGA and GPU architecture, and cloud-based architectures combining heterogeneous processing resources. Programming paradigms including CUDA, MapReduce and OpenMP.

title: EE 452L Game Hardware Architectures
description: Architectural principles underlying modern game console hardware design; introduction to the programming techniques, optimization strategies, and hardware insights to create powerful games.

title: EE 451 Parallel and Distributed Computation
description: Introduction to parallel programming techniques, models and optimization strategies; Application mapping to multi-core, accelerator, GPU and cloud platforms; High Performance Computing and Data Science applications.

title: EE 450 Introduction to Computer Networks
description: Network architectures; layered protocols, network service interface; local networks; long-haul networks; internal protocols; link protocols; addressing; routing; flow control; higher level protocols.

title: ENDO 705a Seminar: Endodontic Case Presentation
description: Student presentation of cases for critique and analysis.

title: ENDO 704b Seminar: Surgical Endodontics
description: Indications, principles, and techniques of surgical endodontics.

title: ENDO 703d Seminar: Review of Endodontic Literature
description: Critical review and analysis of classical and current endodontic literature.

title: ENDO 704a Seminar: Surgical Endodontics
description: Indications, principles, and techniques of surgical endodontics.

title: EE 481L Control Systems Laboratory

title: EDUC 600 Counseling for College and Career Readiness II

Emphasis on texts by other than British and United States authors. Completion of general education literature requirement highly recommended.

description: State-of-the-art computing devices; current trends in device technologies; future directions.

title: EDUC 593a Master's Seminar

title: EE 635 Advanced Wireless Communications

description: An examination and analysis of research and literature in the student's area of focus.

title: EDUC 592b Applied Linguistics for TESOL

title: EE 632 Integrated Communication Systems

description: Planning and implementing effective educational services for students receiving special education services. Potential interventions for family support. Coordination of services.

description: Examination of legal problems and concepts in English and American literature.

title: ENGL 350g Literature of California

title: ENGL 299g Introduction to the Genre of Poetry

description: For the master's degree. Credit on acceptance of thesis.

description: Principles of magnetic resonance imaging. Spin physics, Fourier-based acquisition and reconstruction, generation of tissue contrast, fast imaging, artifact correction, advanced image reconstruction.

title: EE 592 Computational Methods for Inverse Problems
description: Vector-space methods for solving inverse problems. Existence and uniqueness of solutions; conditioning and regularization; iterative algorithms; constrained optimization; applications in signal and image processing.

title: EE 590 Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

title: EE 587 Nonlinear and Adaptive Control

title: EE 583 Statistical Signal Processing

title: EE 586L Advanced DSP Design Laboratory

title: EE 584 Chaotic Systems

title: EE 585 Linear System Theory

title: ENGL 280g Introduction to Narrative Medicine
description: Study of literary modes of narrative and their uses in medical understanding, character formation, social identity, and relations between mind and body.

title: EDUC 573 Introduction to Special Education
description: Effective and appropriate educational settings for students with disabilities. Legal and professional responsibilities. Components for an inclusive classroom.

description: Satisfies New General Education in Category B: Humanistic Inquiry
