description: Parameter matrices, approximate design procedures for distributed networks from lumped networks, coupled lines, equivalent coupled-line circuits, Kuroda's identities, and capacitance matrix transformations.

title: EE 570b Advanced Electromagnetic Theory
description: Classical electromagnetic field theory and its usage in understanding and analytically modelling advanced applied electrical engineering devices.

title: ENE 580 Applied Environmental Engineering Biotechnology
description: Fundamentals of bioremediation processes; bioremediation technologies for decontamination of air, water, and soil; global applications of bioremediation techniques.

title: ENE 590 Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

title: ENE 560 Environmental Aspects of Oil and Gas Production
description: Environmental aspects of drilling for and producing oil and gas, and the necessary safety practices. Attention is given to the urban areas.

title: ENE 535 Air Pollution Management: Exposure, Health Effects and Risk
description: Pollutant sampling; occupational, community, and personal exposures; receptor modeling; data analysis; health effects of air pollutants.

title: ENE 518 Environmental Systems Engineering and Management
description: Evaluating, implementing and managing effective environmental systems to prevent pollution, conserve energy and resources, reduce risks and achieve sustainability in business and industries.

title: ENE 527 Climate Change and Atmospheric Aerosols
description: Climate change; climate science fundamentals; Earth's energy balance and atmosphere; greenhouse gas dynamics; fundamentals of airborne particles; climate-aerosol interactions; particle-radiation and particle-cloud interactions.

title: ENE 512 Environmental Fluid Mechanics
description: Environmental fluid mechanics (air and surface/ground water); flow kinematics; viscous/inviscid flow; boundary layer theory; steady/unsteady groundwater flows; turbulence; Reynolds equations; contaminant transport

title: ENE 506 Ecology for Environmental Engineers
description: The role of environmental engineering in maintaining stability of freshwater, marine, and terrestrial ecosystems; macroscopic plant and animal forms as indicators of water quality.

title: ENE 516 Hazardous Waste Management
description: Standards and regulations for the management of hazardous waste: identification, transportation, monitoring, storage, treatment, and disposal practices.

title: ENE 510 Water Quality Management and Practice
description: Surface and ground water quality and resources management; water pollution in aquatic environment; water/wastewater infrastructure systems and management.

title: ENE 502 Environmental and Regulatory Compliance
description: Federal and state environmental laws; environmental impact assessment techniques; permitting for industrial facility construction and operation.

title: EE 570a Advanced Electromagnetic Theory
description: Classical electromagnetic field theory and its usage in understanding and analytically modelling advanced applied electrical engineering devices.

title: ENE 499 Special Topics
description: Course content to be selected each semester from recent developments in environmental engineering and related fields.

title: ENE 495 Seminars in Environmental Engineering
description: Hazardous waste management, biodegradation of environmental pollutants, groundwater problems, waste minimization, energy resources, and air pollution control.

title: ENE 505 Energy and the Environment
description: Environmental effects of energy development using fossil and fissile fuels, geothermics, photosynthesis, and other sources. Relationship of elemental cycles to the life supporting systems.

title: ENE 486 Design of Solid and Hazardous Waste Engineering Systems
description: Engineering design of solid and hazardous waste facilities such as waste minimization, secured landfill, and hazardous waste treatment.

title: ENE 487 Environmental Biotechnology and Bioremediation
description: Understanding and designing microbiological processes for environmental protection; learning how processes in environmental biotechnology work; emerging applications for bioremediation of hazardous chemicals in the environment.

title: ENE 426 Particulate Air Pollutants: Properties/Behavior/Measurement
description: Particulate air pollutants, their measurement and instrumentation methods, and their effects on the environment and human health; optical properties and visibility degradation.

title: ENE 429 Air Pollution Control
description: Emission surveys; engineering controls of aerosols and gaseous contaminants at emission sources, disposition of contaminants. Field trips.

title: ENE 201 Introduction to Applied Environmental Science and Engineering
description: Gateway to BS in Civil Engineering (Environmental Engineering), BS, Environmental Engineering, and Minor in Environmental Engineering. Fundamental concepts of environmental science and engineering. Pollution control and remediation for air, water and soil. Pollution remediation for developing countries.

title: ENE 390 Special Problems
description: Supervised, individual studies. No more than one registration permitted. Enrollment by petition only.

title: ENE 410 Environmental Fluid Mechanics
description: Equation of motion; continuity, momentum, energy principles; dimensional analysis, similitudes; groundwater flows; transports in conduits and channels; mixing, dispersion in environments; manifold diffusers; hydraulic transients.

title: ENDO 761f Clinic: Advanced Endodontics
description: Advanced clinical experience emphasizing the diagnosis and management of complicated endodontic cases.

title: ENDO 790 Directed Research: Endodontics
description: Principles of planning, organizing, and executing a clinical or educational research project.

title: ENE 428 Air Pollution Fundamentals
description: Air pollution effects on man, vegetation, materials; pollutant sampling and analysis; air quality standards and criteria; meteorological factors and dispersion modeling.

title: ENDO 761e Clinic: Advanced Endodontics
description: Advanced clinical experience emphasizing the diagnosis and management of complicated endodontic cases.

title: ENE 200 Environmental Engineering Principles
description: Analysis of water, air, and land pollution, including hazardous waste, and engineering of mitigation measures. Water and wastewater treatment systems.

title: ENDO 761c Clinic: Advanced Endodontics
description: Advanced clinical experience emphasizing the diagnosis and management of complicated endodontic cases.

title: ENDO 761d Clinic: Advanced Endodontics
description: Advanced clinical experience emphasizing the diagnosis and management of complicated endodontic cases.

title: ENDO 761b Clinic: Advanced Endodontics
description: Advanced clinical experience emphasizing the diagnosis and management of complicated endodontic cases.

title: ENDO 761a Clinic: Advanced Endodontics
description: Advanced clinical experience emphasizing the diagnosis and management of complicated endodontic cases.

title: COMM 654 Art, Artists and Society
description: Cultural and temporal differences in defining arts, artists and audiences; transmitting cultural beliefs through art; understanding aesthetic responses; experiences of alienation and incomprehension with art.

title: COMM 794b Doctoral Dissertation
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: COMM 794a Doctoral Dissertation
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: COMM 790 Research
description: Research leading to the doctorate. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the school.

title: COMM 675 Independent Study
description: A supervised course tailored to specific student interests. The professor and student develop a syllabus that permits exploration of advanced or specialized topics.

title: COMM 672 Experiments in Critical Writing
description: Seminar and workshop dedicated to the practice of critical non-fiction writing, and the role of the creative impulse in scholarly criticism and print journalism.

title: COMM 670 Economic Cultures
description: Explores and analyzes the interaction between culture and economy by observing different types of economic practices.

title: ARCH 421 Digital Architectural Photography
description: Perceiving and documenting the built environment through the perspective and frame of the digital camera. Mastering the basic principles of the digital image through an understanding of frame, light, exposure, color correction, and printing output.

title: COMM 694 Preliminary Research Paper
description: Independent research designed to demonstrate the student's ability to conceptualize, conduct, and present scholarly research.

title: ANTH 576L Anthropological Media Seminar
description: A hands-on laboratory-based survey of preproduction techniques in video and audio production, including exercises to prepare students to shoot their own documentaries.

title: AME 585 Aerospace Structures II
description: Analysis of repairs in aircraft/launch vehicles. Flexible dynamics for spacecraft, random vibration, deployable spacecraft components, certification of thermal protection systems. Practical finite element analysis.

title: ANST 513 Advanced Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia III
description: Correlation of advanced techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory in diverse specialty anesthesia rotations.

title: AMST 390 Special Problems
description: Supervised, individual studies. No more than one registration; by petition only.

title: COMM 489 Campaign Communication
description: Problems in political communication: creating an informed electorate, use of mass media, factors in voter persuasion. Guest experts in political analysis, opinion polling, communication evaluation.

title: AMST 343 Food, Health and Culture in Los Angeles
description: Examination of Los Angeles' diverse food cultures as well as the food justice issues that affect many low-income residents of neighborhoods surrounding USC campus.

title: AME 579 Combustion Chemistry and Physics
description: Thermodynamics of combustion processes. Reaction mechanisms of hydrocarbon combustion. Pollutant formation. Theories and application of thermochemical kinetics and reaction rate theories. Transport in reacting flows.

title: AME 582 Nuclear Reactor Physics
description: Neutron-induced fission chain reactions, reactor criticality. Neutron transport and diffusion in nuclear reactors. Mathematical/computational foundation for diffusion theory and transport calculations for fission reactor design/analysis.

title: AME 583 Effects of Radiation on Health
description: Nuclear physics relevant to human health. Biological effects of radiation, quantification and measurement of different types of radiation affecting living tissue, radiation protection, nuclear accidents.

title: ADNT 703a Seminar: Combined Treatment Planning
description: Interdisciplinary consideration of complex cases which involve several of the dental specialties.

title: AHIS 490x Directed Research
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: AHIS 220g Medieval Visual Culture
description: Medieval visual culture as an introduction to the Christian heritage of western civilization and to the interaction of Church and state from the 3rd to the 13th century.

title: AHIS 230 Art and Culture in Early Modern Europe
description: Survey of European art from the 15th to the 17th century. Case studies in Renaissance and Baroque art with emphasis on artists in major urban centers.

title: AME 581 Introduction to Nuclear Engineering
description: Review of basic nuclear physics, binding energy, reactor kinetics, thermal transport in reactor systems, radioactivity, shielding, reactor safety and health effects of radiation, risk assessment. Open only to graduate students.

title: ADNT 701 Research Methodologies in Dentistry
description: Critical evaluation of the scientific principles in the development, execution, and interpretation of methodologies used in dentistry.

title: ADNT 702 Physical Diagnosis
description: Didactic and clinical experience in physical diagnosis relevant to practice of the dental specialties.

title: ACMD 615 Maintenance of Competence in the Health Professions
description: Maintenance of competence and continuing professional development (CPD) of physicians and other health care professionals; trends, needs, strategies, assessing outcomes, examining effectiveness of CPD programs.

title: ACMD 621 Capstone Portfolio for the Master of Academic Medicine
description: Role of portfolios for teachers and learners; develop a personal capstone portfolio that represents each learner's accomplishment of the core competencies of the MACM program.

title: ACMD 604 Supporting the Educational Enterprise in Academic Medicine
description: Explores support functions in academic medical centers and health professions schools; financial, scientific, educational, faculty and student affairs departments, and offices of medical education.

title: ACMD 605 Faculty Development for Health Sciences Faculty Educators
description: Role of faculty development programs in health professions schools; tools for delivering effective continuing education and faculty development; models for mentoring clinical faculty.

title: ACMD 598 Fieldwork: Designing Innovations for the Health Professions
description: Individual projects designing curricular or other innovations for the home program as an application of Year 1 concepts and as part of the capstone experience.

title: ACMD 593 Foundations of Academic Writing
description: A completed study of an innovation in academic medicine or other health-related field that is ready to move to publication.

title: ACMD 592 Implementing Research on Innovation in Academic Medicine
description: Mentored research on an innovation in academic medicine leading to the master's degree. The project will result in a formal written research report.

title: ACMD 591 Designing Research on Innovations in Academic Medicine
description: Introduction to design and scholarly review of innovations in health professions education; needs assessment, problem selection, use of research methods to study an innovation.

title: ACMD 513 Professionalism in Academic Medicine and Health
description: Acquisition and evaluation of interpersonal and communication skills and professionalism including ethics and cultural competence; within the context of health care disparities and health initiatives.

title: ACMD 512 Competencies in Academic Medicine and Health II
description: Learning theory, teaching methods, assessment techniques related to acquisition and reinforcement of competencies related to patient care, practice based learning and improvement and systems-based practice.

title: ACMD 514 Accreditation and Program Evaluation in Academic Medicine
description: Evaluating health professions training programs within guidelines of relevant accreditation organizations; models of evaluation, designing plans and tools for evaluation of program elements.

title: ACMD 503 Leading Change in Academic Medical Centers
description: Exploration and practice of skills for promoting programs within academic medicine and health professions' education; building trust, organizational change, conflict resolution, negotiation, and managing resources.

title: ACCT 699 Special Topics
description: Exploration of emerging topics, literature and research techniques in contemporary accounting.

title: ACMD 511 Competencies in Academic Medicine and Health I
description: Acquisition of cognitive knowledge and problem-solving skills in health professions worldwide; instructional methods, assessment techniques, designing curricula for health professions education.

title: ACMD 502 Becoming a Leader in Academic Medicine Worldwide
description: Current approaches to leadership within the context of global academic medicine and health professions education; individual applications, group dynamics, teamwork, and interpersonal skill enhancement.

title: ACMD 501 Introduction to Academic Medicine Worldwide
description: Introduces the master's program; includes historical development of training in the health professions; current issues, challenges and opportunities in academic medicine and health worldwide.

title: ACCT 661b Accounting Research Methodology
description: Advanced doctoral seminar concerned with review and critique of accounting research forum papers and with the preparation, presentation, and defense of research proposals and papers.

title: ACCT 661a Accounting Research Methodology
description: Advanced doctoral seminar concerned with review and critique of accounting research forum papers and with the preparation, presentation, and defense of research proposals and papers.

title: ACCT 621 Research Forum
description: Seminar. Review and discuss current research in Accounting. Presentations by faculty, visiting researchers, and advanced students.

title: ACCT 630 Auditing and Archival Research
description: Survey of major topics and methods in archival auditing research, research design methodologies, use of STATA and statistical modeling.

title: ACCT 611 Selected Topics in Accounting Research
description: Advanced seminar to address issues/topics covered in accounting research.

title: ACCT 608 Positive Accounting Research
description: Survey of major topics related to positive accounting research with coverage of both key research questions and frequently used methods.

title: ACCT 610 Survey of Accounting Research
description: Advanced seminar that surveys both seminal and cutting edge research in financial accounting, managerial accounting, accounting information systems, and tax accounting.

title: ACCT 606 Survey of Tax Research
description: Survey of major topics and methods in research on taxation with coverage of both key research questions and frequently used methods.

title: ACCT 605 Survey of Financial Reporting Research
description: Survey of major topics and methods in research on financial reporting with coverage of both key research questions and frequently used methods.

title: ACCT 604 Survey of Management Accounting Research
description: Survey of major topics in accounting research with coverage of both key research questions and frequently used methods.

title: ACCT 602 Survey of Judgment and Decision-Making Research in Accounting
description: Survey of major topics in judgment and decision-making research in accounting with coverage of both key research questions and frequently used methods.

title: ACCT 597 Consulting Project in Accounting
description: Individual or team project solving real business problems for an existing business entity, domestic and/or international. Proposal, field research, analyses and oral and written presentations.

title: ACCT 599 Special Topics
description: Registration Restriction: Online registration limited to graduate business and accounting students

title: ACCT 592 Field Research in Accounting
description: Individual or team projects studying the business practices of an industry, company, government agency, country, geographic region, etc. Proposal, data collection, analyses, and written report.

title: ACCT 596 Research Practicum in Accounting
description: Hands-on practical experience working with a Leventhal faculty member on an ongoing research project.

title: ACCT 595 Internship in Accounting
description: Supervised on-the-job business experience in the field of Accounting. (Curricular Practical Training). Application required.

title: ACCT 593 Independent Research in Accounting
description: Independent research beyond normal course offerings. Proposal, research and written report/paper required.

title: ACCT 588 Analysis and Implications of SEC Registration and Reporting
description: Legal, institutional, and economic implications of being a U.S. public company. The Securities and Exchange Commission and its influence on investors, management, underwriters, and accountants.

title: ACCT 590 Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the School of Accounting. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the school.

title: ACCT 587 Forensic Accounting
description: Role of the accountant in litigation matters. Identification and exploration of the analytical and communication tools necessary to be an effective forensic accountant.

title: ACCT 585 Professional Responsibilities in Accounting
description: A case study approach to the integration of accounting and auditing knowledge; research, communication, and interpersonal skills developed through extensive written and presentation requirements.

title: ACCT 584 Family Wealth Preservation
description: Registration Restriction: Online registration limited to graduate business and accounting students

title: ACCT 583 Income Tax Accounting and Auditing
description: Examination of FAS 109 and roles of auditors, tax professionals and corporate financial personnel in preparing, analyzing and reviewing accrual of income taxes.

title: ACCT 580T Tax Accounting Methods
description: Concepts governing timing of recognition of income and deductions for income tax purposes. Covers differences between GAAP and income tax accounting for all taxpayers.

title: ACCT 578T Advanced Corporate Taxation
description: Analysis of corporate divisions and reorganizations, carryovers, and other advanced topics in corporate taxation.

title: ACCT 581 Financial Statement Analysis
description: Analysis of corporate financial reports from a decision-maker's perspective. This course is case-and-applications-oriented. Applications include credit analysis, equity valuation, and financial distress.

title: ACCT 579T Advanced International Taxation
description: Analysis of tax treaties, foreign currency transactions, international licensing, reorganization of foreign corporations, and other current topics as the law changes.

title: ACCT 577T Compensation
description: Concepts of taxation of employers and employees from various forms of compensation, including pension plans, profit sharing plans, stock ownership plans, and deferred compensation arrangements.

title: ACCT 576T Tax Consolidations
description: Concepts and principles of taxation of companies operating as consolidated groups.

title: ACCT 575T Taxation of Financial Markets
description: Taxation of financial market products with focus on derivative products. Basics of tax forwards, futures, options, swaps, collars and floor. Time value of money considerations.

title: ACCT 574 Accounting and Corporate Governance in Global Business
description: How corporate governance and financial reporting systems are influenced by business environments internationally. Global perspective of governance and reporting challenges and mechanisms for their remedy.

title: ACCT 570T State and Local Tax Concepts
description: State income taxes; property tax; other state and local taxes; the effect of state and local taxes on multistate operations.

title: ACCT 572 Corporate Accounting and Reporting
description: A study of financial reporting and disclosure issues with an emphasis on the use of corporate financial statements and their accompanying footnotes.

title: ACCT 571T Taxation of Individuals
description: Application of tax law in areas of compensation planning, investment planning, tax shelters, and current developments relating to the individual taxpayer.

title: ACCT 568T International Taxation
description: Taxation of cross-border transactions of U.S. citizens and corporations and of U.S. source income of foreign persons and corporations; planning for organization of international operations under the tax laws.

title: ACCT 569T Advanced Partnership Taxation
description: Advanced tax concepts involving partnerships and limited liability companies, designed to produce a level of expertise in Subchapter K of the Internal Revenue Code.

title: ACCT 573T Federal Tax Procedure
description: Tax reporting and collection procedures; administrative and judicial procedures governing tax controversies; the rights and obligations of the taxpayer.

title: ACCT 567T Taxation of Transactions in Property
description: Taxation of gains and losses from sales, exchanges and other transactions involving property, especially real estate; tax planning.

title: ACCT 563T Federal Estate and Gift Taxes
description: Taxation of decedents' estates and lifetime gifts; valuation of property subject to estate and gift taxes.

title: ACCT 560T Tax Theory and Ethics
description: Taxation and its relationship to business and investment decisions; the effects of taxation on business organization, capital structure, policies, operation, and expansion.

title: ACCT 562 Methods and Motivations of Financial Reporting Fraud
description: Discover and analyze signals of major and frequently committed methods of fraudulent financial reporting; explore current reforms in financial reporting, auditing, and corporate governance.

title: ACCT 559 Strategy and Operations Through CFO Lens
description: Examination of strategic objectives and operations within specific industries and companies. Chief Financial Officers present how they view the business as a whole and measure performance effectively.

title: ACCT 558 Advanced Accounting Valuation
description: Explores complex valuation issues arising in financial reporting and the related professional standards and guidance.

title: ACCT 561T Income Tax of Corporations and Their Shareholders
description: Concepts and principles governing the taxation of corporations and their shareholders; the effect of taxes on corporate formation, capital structure, distributions, and liquidations.

title: ACCT 557 Advanced Financial Statement Auditing Topics
description: Advanced coverage of topics in financial statement auditing including market effects of auditing, auditor litigation and client acceptance, errors and fraud, analytical procedures, and going-concern assessment.

title: ACCT 553T Tax Policy and Strategic Tax Planning
description: Introduction to business taxes and their impact on management decisions. For prospective managers and business consultants, topics include discounted cash flow, financial accounting, and overall business impacts of taxes on decision making.

title: ACCT 551T Taxation of Partnerships and S-Corps
description: Federal taxation of flow-through entities, including: partnerships, S corporations, limited liability partnerships (LLPs) and limited liability companies (LLCs).

title: ACCT 550T Tax Research and Professional Responsibilities
description: Tax law research methods; interpreting statutes, cases and rulings; communicating research results; administration and professional responsibilities of tax practice.

title: ACCT 548L IT Audit and Data Applications
description: Exploration of the role systems play in organizations, the technology that supports these systems and issues relating to technology risk, system/application security and system review/audit.

title: ACCT 549 Advanced Enterprise Systems and Technologies
description: Design, control and development of advanced enterprise systems, using reengineering, focusing on accounting and financial systems, using a wide range of emerging existing technologies.

title: ACCT 547 Enterprise Information Systems
description: Focuses on accounting enterprise database models and information technology required to support those systems. Includes analysis and design of interfunctional process flows through reengineering to exploit technology capabilities.

title: ACCT 542 Fraud Analytics in the Audit
description: Understanding/identifying fraud risk from an auditor's perspective; development of an analytics skillset to detect financial fraud risk.

title: ACCT 546 Auditing and Assurance Services
description: Concepts and principles governing independent professional services that provide assurance on the reliability and relevance of information, including financial statement information. Topics include demand and supply issues for these services, basic principles of evidence, risk assessment and testing.

title: ACCT 540 Technological Innovations in Accounting and Auditing
description: New, emerging and potential technologies for accounting and audit, emphasizing data and analytics.  Actual and potential effects of new technologies in accounting and auditing settings.

title: ACCT 537 Performance Measurement, Evaluation, and Incentives
description: Financial responsibility centers, financial and nonfinancial performance measures, budgets and other targets, evaluation techniques and styles, incentives. Strategy implementation and execution. Corporate governance.

title: ACCT 541L Auditing in the Enhanced Data Age
description: Framework of the audit model including use of large data sets with automated audit tools. A lab environment is an integral part of the course.

title: ACCT 536 Advanced Cost Analysis and Management Accounting
description: Analysis and design of systems that provide cost information useful in making strategic and operating decisions. Advantages and limitations of activity-based costing methods.

title: AHIS 465 Studies in American Art
description: In-depth exploration of a specified topic in the history of American art.

title: ACCT 535 Management and Cost Accounting
description: Presentation of accounting data for management use in decision making; cost accounting, profit planning, decision analysis, systems for revenue and costs control, responsibility accounting.

title: AHIS 460 Studies in 18th and 19th Century Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within the area of 18th and 19th century art and architecture.

title: AHIS 449 History of Prints and Drawings
description: Aspects of the history of the graphic arts; stylistic and technical considerations may both be included or specific areas stressed at the choice of the instructor.

title: AHIS 436 The Philosophy of Art
description: Discusses writings on aesthetics, the history of aesthetics and art criticism, the philosophy of art, and modern philosophical notions such as genius and originality.

title: AHIS 433 Studies in Medieval Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within the area of Medieval art and architecture.

title: AHIS 428 Studies in Colonial Latin American Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within colonial Latin American art.

title: AHIS 429 Studies in Art, Science, and Technology
description: Examination of the connections between art, science, and technology, focusing on a specific time period and/or set of questions.

title: AHIS 453 Studies in Baroque Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within the area of 17th century art and architecture.

title: AHIS 427 Archaeological Theories, Methods, and Practice
description: Examined are various theoretical approaches, methods, and practice of archaeology in a seminar style format, with lectures, oral presentations, and museum visits.

title: AHIS 430 Studies in Renaissance Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within the area of Renaissance art and architecture.

title: AHIS 420 Studies in Ancient Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within the area of Ancient art and architecture.

title: AHIS 400x Undergraduate Apprenticeship
description: Independent work in art museums, galleries or art history related institutes supervised by on-site professionals and USC faculty. Not available for credit to art history majors. Available to upper-division art history majors only.

title: AHIS 390 Special Problems
description: Supervised, individual studies. No more than one registration permitted. Enrollment by petition only.

title: ACCT 530L Ethics for Professional Accountants
description: Provides the ethical grounding that accountants need to identify ethical issues and reconcile conflicts among competing stakeholder interests.

title: ACCT 532 Financial Accounting for Mergers and Acquisitions
description: Practical problems in accounting for business combinations. Consolidated financial statements: fair value, acquisition and equity basis accounting.

title: ACCT 528 Fair Value Accounting: GAAP, IFRS and Emerging Issues
description: Case study approach to explore fair value issues in accounting; research and analysis of causes of valuation differences.

title: ACCT 527 Financial Statement Analysis - Audit Perspective
description: Analysis of corporate financial reports to evaluate the firm's past and present performance as well as to predict likely future performance from an auditor's perspective.

title: ACCT 533 Mergers and Acquisitions: Tax Planning and Strategy
description: Tax planning and strategy in corporate restructuring including mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures. Tax background not required to be successful in this course.

title: ACCT 526 Global Accounting Experience
description: Cross-border transactions in the global economy examining accounting, legal, and tax environments, economic and political systems, and cultural differences. Includes international travel to selected region.

title: ACCT 525x Intensive Accounting Principles and Practices
description: Technical accounting theory and principles necessary for graduate work. Satisfies the prerequisite requirements for intermediate and advanced accounting, auditing, and tax.

title: ACCT 509 Concepts of Financial and Management Accounting
description: Introduction to the concepts of financial and managerial accounting. The course will provide coverage of key concepts needed by managers of businesses in order to communicate information important in decision-making.

title: ACCT 495 Accounting Internship: Work, Ethics and Communication
description: Provides insights and tools for the work environment specifically integrating technical, communication and ethical decision-making; bridging classroom learning and "real world" experience.

title: ACCT 494 Marshall Honors Research and Thesis
description: Experience in conducting research and writing a thesis under supervision of a faculty adviser.

title: ACCT 490x Directed Research
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: ACCT 478 Accounting Systems Design
description: Explores the design of accounting systems. Introduction to tools and techniques for analyzing and designing accounting systems with an emphasis on system controls and reporting.

title: ACCT 499 Special Topics
description: Selected topics reflecting current trends and recent developments in the field of accounting. Topics vary each semester.

title: ACCT 479 Accounting Systems Development
description: Examines the fundamentals of accounting systems development. Introduction to the concepts of implementation and support, with emphasis on system quality assurance, evaluation and attestation.

title: ACCT 477 Intermediate Fair Value Issues in Accounting
description: Develops the ability to identify and understand new areas of emerging guidance involving fair value issues and to recognize and demonstrate appropriate application of methodologies.

title: ACCT 475 Systems Security and Audit
description: Issues related to the security, control, and auditing of accounting information systems.

title: ACCT 476 Performance Measurement Issues
description: Introduction to understanding how management control systems can enhance achievement of the organization's objectives and strategies.

title: ACCT 493 Leventhal Honors Research Seminar
description: Provides the methodological tools to identify research problems, develop researchable hypotheses, apply appropriate methodologies, conduct research, derive meaningful conclusions from data, write a research proposal.

title: ACCT 474 Tax Issues for Business
description: Capabilities to identify and articulate tax issues related to a business entity's life: formation, investing, financing and operations, and change of form.

title: AME 308 Computer-Aided Analyses for Aero-Mechanical Design
description: Introduction to the finite element method; practical application of computer analysis tools for structural analysis and design.

title: ACCT 472 Managerial Accounting
description: Understanding of systems providing cost information useful in management decision-making and problem solving.

title: ACCT 471 Accounting Information Systems
description: Issues related to the design, control, and implementation of accounting information systems.

title: ACCT 470 Advanced External Financial Reporting Issues
description: Develop capabilities to identify and resolve advanced external financial reporting challenges, focusing primarily on operating, financing, and investing activities of business enterprises. Duplicates credit in ACCT 470ab.

title: AME 305 Mechanical Design
description: Design and analysis of mechanical elements including shafts, bearings, springs, screws, belts and gears; strength, fatigue and deflection considerations in machine design.

title: AME 303 Dynamics of Machinery
description: Kinematics and dynamics of machines; balancing of rotating and reciprocating machinery; gyroscopic effects; critical speeds; energy variation in machinery; introduction to mechanism design.

title: AME 291 Undergraduate Design Projects I
description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended for entry in local and national design competitions. Intended for lower division students or those with little prior project experience.

title: ACCT 473 Financial Statement Auditing
description: , specifically the process used by external auditors to conduct financial statement audits.

title: AME 302 Dynamic Systems
description: Modeling of lumped parameter elements and systems; free and forced response of first and second order systems; design oriented approach to dynamic systems.

title: AME 231L Mechanical Behavior of Materials
description: Material properties of metals, ceramics, and composites; stress-strain relationships; microstructural characteristics; fracture, fatigue, and creep; effects of processing.

title: AME 261 Basic Flight Mechanics
description: Performance of flight vehicles; maximum speed, rate-of-climb, range, and endurance; basic stability and control, weight, and balance; computer exercises.

title: AME 301 Dynamics
description: 2-D and 3-D kinematics and dynamics of particles and rigid bodies; systems of particles and rigid bodies; coupled rigid bodies; introduction to vibrations.

title: AME 150L Introduction to Computational Methods
description: Computer programming; organization of problems for computational solution; introduction to software for computation and graphics; applications to engineering problems.

title: ALI 280 English Skills and Strategies for the Job Search
description: Elective course for undergraduate and graduate international students. Introduces students to job search skills and strategies while focusing on improving their English.

title: ALI 276 Workshop for International Teaching Assistants
description: Language assistance and individualized instruction to help International Teaching Assistants develop the skills and language proficiency necessary to perform their classroom duties.  Graded CR/NC.

title: AME 105 Introduction to Aerospace Engineering
description: Gateway to the Aerospace Engineering major. Introduction to flight vehicle performance and propulsion. Elements of the physics of gases. Laboratory: computers and graphics; model rocket and glider test flights.

title: AME 101L Introduction to Mechanical Engineering and Graphics
description: Gateway to the bachelor of science degree in mechanical engineering. Introduction to mechanical engineering disciplines and practice; graphical communication and layout of machine parts; introduction to computer-aided drafting and drawing.

title: ALI 275 Writing for Publication and Dissertations
description: Elective course for international graduate students focusing on conventions of advanced academic writing and problems in syntax, vocabulary, and register for writing and/or publishing dissertations.

title: AHIS 376 Introduction to African Art
description: An introduction to sub-Saharan art (sculpture, textiles, architecture, masquerades, performances and body arts) in the context of issues of function, gender, politics and ethnic diversity.

title: AHIS 373g History and Theory of Photography
description: Explores key moments in the history of photography from its invention to the present. Issues include modernity and mass culture; photography as a fine art; technologies of vision.

title: AHIS 370g Modern Art III: 1940 to the Present
description: Questions of social engagement and political structure address this examination of major international movements in art since 1940.

title: AHIS 369 Modern Art II: 1851–1940
description: An examination of European modern art and design, focusing on industrialization, urbanism, primitivism, colonialism, and their relations to the arts.

title: AHIS 366 Picturing Democracy: American Art and Visual Culture, 1750-1900
description: Studies the art and visual culture of the United States from nation formation to the World's Columbian Exposition of 1893.

title: AHIS 367 Early American Modernism: American Art and Visual Culture
description: Studies the art and visual culture of the United States between 1876, the date of the Centennial Fair in Philadelphia, to the eve of World War II.

title: AHIS 365m African American Art
description: A survey of the fine arts produced by people of African descent in the United States from the nation's inception in the late 18th century until the contemporary movement.

title: AHIS 368 Modern Art I: 1700–1850
description: A cultural and historical examination of European art and architecture from 1700 (Rococo) to 1850 (Realism), focusing on the beginnings of modernism in the age of revolution.

title: AHIS 361 British Modernism, 1780-1918
description: A survey of art and architecture in Britain from the age of Hogarth to Art Nouveau. Among the artists studied are Constable, Turner, and the Pre-Raphaelites.

title: AHIS 364 Myths, Arts, Realities: Visual Culture in California, 1849 to the Present
description: Diverse interpretations of "the California experience and lifestyle" in paintings, sculpture, photography, cinema, public art and popular culture of the last 150 years.

title: AHIS 357 History of French Art 1860–1920
description: (Paris Semester only) Exploration of the main movements of late 19th and early 20th century French art using the resources of Parisian museums and monuments. Visits to Paris museums are an integral part of the course work.

title: AHIS 344 Baroque Art
description: Painting, sculpture and architecture in 17th century Europe, north and south.

title: AHIS 336 Bodies of Knowledge: Art and Anatomy in Renaissance Europe
description: Explores anatomical knowledge and art making in Renaissance Europe, focusing on collaborations between medical professions, printers and artists in illustrated anatomy books.

title: AHIS 330 Medieval Art
description: Introductory survey of art and architecture of Christianity from 300–1300; biblical themes and classical traditions; cultural and historical analysis of medieval art.

title: AHIS 328 Colonial Latin American Art
description: A survey of the art, architecture, and visual culture of colonial Latin America, focusing on connections to culture and society.

title: AHIS 343 Renaissance Art
description: Painting, sculpture and architecture in Renaissance Europe, north and south, from 1300–1600.

title: ACCT 463 Internal Audit
description: Examination of internal audit/auditors and their relationship to management, the investors, the regulators, and the external auditors.

title: ALI 271 Language Tutorial for International Teaching Assistants
description: Individualized tutorial on the language and oral skills used by international teaching assistants in the performance of his or her duties. Based on observation and feedback.

title: ALI 270 Advanced Oral Communication for ITAs
description: Classroom interaction skills for international teaching assistants, with a focus on the language needed to lead discussions and make presentations.

title: ALI 274 Advanced Academic and Professional Spoken English
description: Required for International Teaching Assistants (ITAs) who, after taking the ITA Oral Interview Exam, are determined to need the particular skills taught in this course.

title: AHIS 325 Roman Archaeological Excavation: Methods and Practice
description: Students learn about archaeological methodology and practice by visiting archaeological sites in Rome and excavating a nearby ancient site.

description: Required for international students assessed to be at the beginning level by the International Student English Examination (ISE) or by the completion of a lower level ALI course.

title: ALI 145 High Intermediate Writing Skills

title: ALI 103x Elective Courses in English as a Second Language for International Students
description: Specialized tutorial classes in listening, speaking, reading, or writing. A maximum of 4 units may be counted toward a degree.

title: ALI 090x Beginning English as a Second Language for International Students
description: Required for international students assessed to have no proficiency in English by the International Student English Examination (ISE).

title: AHIS 319 Mesoamerican Art and Culture
description: Introductory survey of painting, sculpture, and architecture of Mesoamerica before the Spanish conquest presented in their social, cultural, and political contexts.

title: AHIS 794z Doctoral Dissertation
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: AHIS 301 Guardians of the Past? Art Preservation, Ethics, and the Law
description: Introduction to key ethical, historical, and legal debates about art preservation and collecting across the globe.

title: AHIS 282 Korean Art
description: Introduction to the richness and complexity of artistic expression in Korean art through the study of painting, sculpture, ceramics, and architecture through the 19th century.

title: AHIS 318 Arts of the Ancient Andes
description: Survey of the art and architecture of the ancient cultures of the Andes in South America.

title: AHIS 270 L.A. Now: Contemporary Art in Los Angeles
description: Explores the production, display and critical reception of contemporary art, taking Los Angeles as its laboratory.

title: AHIS 250gm Art, Modernity and Difference
description: Consideration of various categories of "The Modern" as they have been constructed in Western art of the late 19th and 20th centuries.

title: AHIS 240g Introduction to American Art
description: An Introduction to North American visual and material culture from the late sixteenth century to the present.

title: AHIS 794d Doctoral Dissertation
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: AHIS 794c Doctoral Dissertation
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

description: Research leading to the doctorate. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

title: AHIS 794a Doctoral Dissertation
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: AHIS 599 Special Topics

title: AHIS 596 Seminar on Advanced Writing and Professionalization in Art History
description: Trains Art History graduate students to write for a variety of professional purposes, such as grant and job applications, conference abstracts, and reviews.

title: AHIS 255g Culture Wars: Art and Social Conflict in the Modern World
description: Examination of social conflicts and political controversies in American culture through the lens of visual art and photography.

title: AHIS 594b Master's Thesis
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: AHIS 595 Internship for Curricular Practical Training
description: Part-time or full-time practical work experience in the student's field of study. The internship must be located at an off-campus facility. Students are individually supervised by faculty. May not be taken until the student has completed at least one semester of enrollment in the graduate program.

title: AHIS 593x Practicum in Teaching the Liberal Arts
description: Practical principles for the long-term development of effective teaching within College disciplines. Intended for teaching assistants in Dornsife College.

title: AHIS 594z Master's Thesis
description: Grading Option: In-progress to Credit/No Credit

title: AHIS 590 Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.

title: AHIS 215g Studies in Architecture and Urbanism
description: Analyzing a wide range of case studies, this course provides a roadmap to analyze and interpret the built environment in many different eras and contexts.

title: AHIS 201g Digging into the Past
description: A broad survey, covering some 8,000 years and focusing on the material culture of the ancient world in a historical and social context.

title: AHIS 128gp Arts of Latin America
description: Survey of the art, architecture, and visual culture of Latin America from the colonial period to the present, focusing on connections to culture and society.

title: AHIS 127g Arts of the Ancient Americas
description: A survey of the art, architecture, and archaeology of the diverse array of peoples and cultures in ancient Mesoamerica and the South American Andean Mountains.

title: AHIS 125gp Arts of Asia I: Antiquity to 1300
description: An introduction to the major art forms and monuments of religious art in India, Southeast Asia, China, and Japan from pre-history to 1300.

title: AHIS 121gp Art and Society: Renaissance to Modern
description: European art and its legacy in the Americas. Painting, sculpture, architecture and other visual media considered in relation to social and cultural history.

title: AHIS 126g Arts of Asia II: 1300 to the Present
description: A survey of the art and architecture of India, China, Korea, and Japan from 1300 to the present.

title: AHIS 120gp Foundations of Western Art
description: Mediterranean and European art and architecture presented in historical, cultural and social context that introduces art history as a discipline.

title: AHIS 100g Introduction to Visual Culture
description: The description and analysis of various forms of visual culture, including both mass media and "high" art representations, both Western and non-Western images.

title: AEST 420b Leadership Laboratory V
description: Advanced leadership experiences for AFROTC continuing cadets.

title: AEST 410b Leadership Laboratory IV
description: Advanced Air Force leadership experience focusing on the practical development of the Air Force officer through command and staff positions within the Cadet Corps.

title: AEST 420a Leadership Laboratory V
description: Advanced leadership experiences for AFROTC continuing cadets.

title: AHIS 529 Seminar in Art, Science, and Technology
description: In-depth exploration of the connections between art, science, and technology, focusing on a specific time period and/or set of questions.

title: AHIS 550 Art, Business and the Law
description: Investigation of the financial, legal and ethical dimensions of the collection and display of cultural property by private and public institutions. Participants will explore the legal and ethical issues related to the public use of museums and visual reproductive technologies.

title: AHIS 522 Writing (and) the History of Art
description: Examination of how various forms of writing and different contexts of presentation shape the visual experience of art and the understanding of its history, encouraging students to think critically about how to develop a voice of their own.

title: AHIS 524 Readings in Greek and Roman Authors on Ancient Art and Monuments
description: Focuses on readings of ancient Greek and Roman authors writing on Greek and Roman art, monuments and topography. Topics vary from year to year. Departmental approval.

title: AHIS 525 Seminar in American Art
description: In-depth exploration of a specified topic in the history of American art.

title: AHIS 528 Seminar in Colonial Latin American Art
description: In-depth exploration of specific topics in the arts of colonial Latin America.

title: AHIS 521 Seminar in Modern German Art
description: In-depth exploration of a specific topic in modern German art of the 19th and early 20th centuries.

title: AHIS 518 Seminar in Chinese Art
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: AHIS 520 Seminar in Modern Art
description: In-depth exploration of a specified topic within the area of European art of the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

title: AHIS 519 Seminar in Japanese Art
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: AHIS 516 Seminar in the History of Photography and Visual Culture
description: Explores the history of photography with emphasis on the way the medium has been used as a form of communication and knowledge transmission.

title: AHIS 517 Seminar in Korean Art
description: In-depth exploration of a specified topic in the history of Korean art.

title: AEST 400b Aerospace Studies IV: National Security Forces in Contemporary American Society
description: Military professionalism and the context in which defense policy is formulated and implemented; national security policy, political/social constraints, and military justice.

title: AEST 400a Aerospace Studies IV: National Security Forces in Contemporary American Society
description: Military professionalism and the context in which defense policy is formulated and implemented; national security policy, political/social constraints, and military justice.

title: AEST 220b Advanced Leadership Laboratory II
description: Additional exposure to the military experience for continuing AFROTC cadets, focusing on customs and courtesies, drill and ceremonies, and the environment of an Air Force officer.

title: AEST 310a Leadership Laboratory III
description: Practical introduction to Air Force leadership focusing on military communicative skills, group dynamics, and application of theories of leadership and management.

title: AEST 300b Aerospace Studies III: Air Force Management and Leadership
description: Air Force management focusing on the new manager in the Air Force milieu. Emphasis on communication skills peculiar to the Air Force.

title: AEST 300a Aerospace Studies III: Air Force Management and Leadership

title: AEST 200a Aerospace Studies II: Air Force History
description: Development of aerospace power in the U.S. through World War II; emphasis on the Army Air Corps; communication skills.

title: AEST 110a Leadership Laboratory I
description: Introduction to the military experience focusing on customs and courtesies, drill and ceremonies, and the environment of an Air Force officer.

title: AEST 200b Aerospace Studies II: Air Force History
description: Development of aerospace power since World War II; emphasis on international confrontations involving the United States; communication skills.

description: Introduction to the military experience focusing on customs and courtesies, drill and ceremonies, and the environment of an Air Force officer.

title: AEST 110b Leadership Laboratory I
description: Introduction to the military experience focusing on customs and courtesies, drill and ceremonies, and the environment of an Air Force officer.

title: AEST 100b Aerospace Studies I: Air Force Mission and Organization
description: Organization and function of NORAD; tactical air, military airlift, systems, logistics, air training and communications commands; Army, Navy, Marines; reserves; separate operating agencies.

title: AEST 100a Aerospace Studies I: Air Force Mission and Organization
description: Introduction to U.S. Air Force and the military profession; USAF organization and functions; Strategic Air Command organization, command, control, and weapons systems; communication skills.

title: ADNT 710 Internship: Dental Education
description: Practical experience teaching predoctoral students. Units and hours variable.

title: AHIS 510 Seminar in Ancient Art
description: Instruction Mode: Lecture

title: AHIS 509 Seminar in Arts of the Ancient Americas
description: In-depth exploration of a specified topic in the arts of the ancient Americas, which includes North, Central, and South America.

title: AHIS 503 Categories and Collections
description: How collections are organized by category — e.g., period, culture, materials, or mode of production. Examines collecting protocols, historiography and modes of collecting and viewing associated with that category.

title: AHIS 502 Markets, Value and the Institutions of Art
description: Intensive examination of economic, societal, and aesthetic frameworks in which art was sold, bought, exhibited and reviewed. Explores how perceptions of art and value were shaped.

title: AHIS 504 Museum Research Assistantship
description: Working within an institution with a collection and reflecting, in class meetings, upon how collections are formed, shaped and used.

title: AHIS 501 Problems in the History and Theory of Collecting and Display
description: Explores the history of patronage, collecting and display in the private and the public spheres (e.g., salons, galleries, museums, and international expositions).

title: AHIS 500 Methods and Theory of Art History
description: Methodologies, theories and critical traditions that have shaped the discipline. Emphasis will vary depending on faculty. Required of all first-year MA and PhD candidates.

title: ADNT 707 Behavior of the Child Patient
description: Child and adolescent psychological growth and development: Human communication, needs, motivation, and learning. Critical analysis of patient management, team treatment, and practice administration.

title: ADNT 706 Seminar: Diseases of Childhood
description: Intraoral hard and soft tissue pathologic conditions in children, common bacterial and viral diseases and their transmission in the pediatric dental environment.

title: ADNT 704c Oral Biology
description: Interdisciplinary consideration of contemporary biology of the cell, bone, teeth, periodontium, occlusion, dental pulp, pain and human growth and development.

title: ADNT 704b Oral Biology
description: Interdisciplinary consideration of contemporary biology of the cell, bone, teeth, periodontium, occlusion, dental pulp, pain and human growth and development.

title: ADNT 704a Oral Biology
description: Interdisciplinary consideration of contemporary biology of the cell, bone, teeth, periodontium, occlusion, dental pulp, pain and human growth and development.

description: Interdisciplinary consideration of complex cases which involve several of the dental specialties.

description: Interdisciplinary consideration of complex cases which involve several of the dental specialties.

description: Interdisciplinary consideration of complex cases which involve several of the dental specialties.

description: Interdisciplinary consideration of complex cases which involve several of the dental specialties.
